exam_name: CMAT - Common Management Admission Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
CMAT exam 2025 will be held in May 2025. The Common Management Admission Test (CMAT) is a national-level business aptitude test conducted by the National Testing Agency (NTA) for admission to PGDM and MBA programmes. The CMAT exam is conducted in more than 300 exam centers in various cities of India in computer-based mode. Every year, more than 70,000 candidates apply for the CMAT entrance exam. Last year, a total of 76,745 candidates registered for the CMAT exam, out of which 65,127 appeared. The NTA will commence the registration process for CMAT 2025 in March. The scorecard for the CMAT exam will be accepted by 1000+ AICTE approved colleges to offer admission into MBA programmes. Some of the top MBA colleges accepting CMAT scores are KJ Somaiya, JBIMS Mumbai, Welingkar, PUMBA, etc.

CMAT Exam 2025: Key Highlights

MBA aspirants planning to take the CMAT entrance test this year can check the key highlights below.

Quick tips to prepare for CMAT Entrance Test 2025

Below tips can help candidates ace 300+ marks in CMAT 2025;

  • Go through the CMAT syllabus and jot down important topics and chapters for preparation. Segregate these topics as per your know-how and make a study plan accordingly devoting more time for preparation of topics that you don’t know
  • Make daily timetable dedicating 7-8 hours for CMAT preparation 
  • Pick the best CMAT books and study material to prepare for the exam. Candidates can also resort to CMAT coaching and CMAT online preparation via youtube, social media and forums
  • CMAT toppers and experts suggest preparing using the CMAT previous year question papers to understand the question paper format, types of questions asked in exam, repetition of questions and more
  • Students are also suggested to keep giving CMAT mock tests simultaneously to identify their mistakes and strengthen their preparation

CMAT Exam 2025: Common Questions and Answers

Some commonly asked questions around the CMAT exam have been answered below.

CMAT FAQsCMAT Answers

What is CMAT full form?

Common Management Admission Test (CMAT)

Is CMAT conducted twice a year? In which month CMAT exam is conducted every year?

CMAT is conducted once a year in the month of April or May

Is CMAT 2025 registration open?

No, as of now, there is no update on the commencement of the CMAT 2025 application window.

What is the syllabus of CMAT?

CMAT syllabus includes topics from Quantitative Techniques and Data Interpretation, Logical Reasoning, Language Comprehension, General Awareness, and Innovation & Entrepreneurship

Is CMAT accepted by IIMs?


No, CMAT is not accepted by IIMs. MBA at IIMs can only be pursued by giving CAT exam

Which college is best under CMAT?

JBIMS, PUMBA, IMT, XIME, BIMTECH, XISS

What is the CMAT exam used for?

Admission to postgraduate management programmes (MBA/PGDM/PGP/PGPM)

Is CMAT exam necessary for MBA? Is CMAT eligible for MBA?

CMAT score is accepted by all AICTE approved institutes but it is not a mandatory requirement for MBA admission as some colleges grant direct admission, meaning MBA without entrance exam

Which is better, CAT or CMAT?

CAT and CMAT are national-level MBA entrance exams whose scores are widely accepted. Both are conducted annually to assess verbal, quantitative and reasoning skills of management aspirants 

How do I login to the CMAT portal?

Using CMAT login credentials (application number and date of birth/password), candidates can visit their dashboard.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The National Testing Agency (NTA) will release the CMAT eligibility criteria in the official CMAT notification. Over the years, there has been no change in CMAT exam eligibility. So, expect the same eligibility this year too.  It is important for MBA aspirants planning to appear for CMAT exam 2025 to go through the CMAT criteria and apply only after meeting the same. Ineligible candidates will be disqualified at later stages of MBA admission. 

CMAT Exam 2025: Eligibility Criteria

CMAT eligibility criteria 2025 will define the basic requirements in terms of nationality, age, qualification, etc. Check the CMAT entrance exam eligibility criteria below.

  1. Nationality: Only Indian citizens can apply for CMAT exam 2025
  2. Academic qualifications: Graduates in any discipline from recognized institutes can apply for the CMAT exam. Final-year students can also apply for CMAT entrance test
  3. Age limit: Candidate of any age can register for CMAT MBA entrance exam 2025

CMAT 2025 Eligibility Criteria: Course Wise

CMAT colleges can have their own MBA course eligibility criteria, which can differ from CMAT exam eligibility criteria. Candidates applying to the MBA courses based on CMAT test score 2025 are suggested to check the respective course eligibility criteria before applying.

  • For PGDM: A bachelor’s in any discipline
  • For Executive PGDM: Graduation degree in any discipline with a minimum of five years of work experience
  • For MBA & PGDM: A bachelor’s in any discipline

application_process.html_content:
CMAT exam 2025 application form window will be opened on the official website in March 2025. Students interested in pursuing an MBA or PGDM from top CMAT colleges must apply for the CMAT exam 2025 at the CMAT NTA website, exams.nta.ac.in/CMAT/ on or before the last date. Before applying for this MBA entrance, candidates are suggested to check their eligibility and proceed only after ensuring they are eligible to avoid disqualification at a later stage. 

CMAT Exam Registration 2025: Step-by-step guide

CMAT exam 2025 registration is a two-step process, as detailed below.

Step 1: Create CMAT 2025 login

Applicants will have to fill in the following basic information and note down the system generated CMAT application number 2025: 

  1. Candidate‟s Name/ Mother‟s Name/ Father‟s Name as given in the Secondary School Examination or equivalent Board/University Certificate in capital letters. No prefix in the name of the candidate is allowed. 
  2. Date of birth as recorded in Secondary School Examination or equivalent Board/ University Certificate.
  3. Mobile number and email address

Step 2: Fill in the complete CMAT 2025 application form

Using the CMAT exam 2025 login details, candidates can proceed further with filling out the CMAT application form. 

  1. Add personal, academic, and contact details
  2. Add 4 options of CMAT test cities 
  3. Attach scanned images of necessary documents 
  4. Upload scanned images of signature, photographs, and PwD certification in specified format and size
  5. Review the details and submit the form 
  6. Pay the CMAT exam application fees and save the confirmation page

Candidates whose CMAT exam 2025 application form is successfully submitted will only be issued the CMAT admit card.

admit_card.html_content:
The National Testing Agency (NTA) will issue the CMAT exam 2025 admit card online mode at the official website - exams.nta.ac.in/CMAT/. Applicants can download the NTA CMAT entrance exam hall ticket by entering their CMAT login credentials, such as their application number and date of birth.

Sample CMAT Exam Admit Card Image 

Candidates must keep the NTA CMAT exam 2025 admit card safe until admissions are completed, as a duplicate one will not be issued. 

Also read: Know how to prepare for CMAT?

How to download the CMAT exam admit card 2025?

Step 1: Go to the CMAT official website, exams.nta.ac.in/CMAT/
Step 2: Click on the download link of the CMAT exam hall ticket 2025
Step 3: Enter the CMAT exam 2025 application number and password/date of Birth.
Step 4: Click on the "Download CMAT exam Admit Card" button on the page.
Step 5: Check details, save the admit card in PDF format and take a printout of the same.

CMAT Exam 2025 Admit Card: How to Retrieve the CMAT 2025 application number?

Aspirants who have forgotten their CMAT 2025 application number can retrieve it using the facility provided by the NTA authorities on its official CMAT website. To do so, students can use the "Find Application Number" link here. Steps to follow

  • Step 1: Find and visit the link "Find CMAT exam application number" at exams.nta.ac.in/CMAT/.
    Step 2: Enter the required details like Candidate Name, Father Name, Mother Name, Date of Birth and Security Pin (case sensitive).
    Step 3: Click on "Get application number" to avail of the CMAT application number.

Might be interested in- How to prepare for CMAT exam in one month

Documents to carry with the CMAT exam admit card:

The following documents must be carried by all candidates on the CMAT exam day and shown on demand else they will not be allowed to appear for the exam.

  1. Passport-size photograph (same as uploaded on the Online Application Form). This will be pasted on the attendance sheet at the exam centre during CMAT 2025.
  2. Any valid and non-expired authorized Govt photo IDs in original- PAN card/ Driving License/ Voter ID/ Passport/ Aadhaar Card (With photograph)/ Aadhaar Enrolment No/ Ration Card
  3. PwD certificate (if applicable)

Note: If the name of the candidate has changed due to events such as marriage etc, such candidates must show the relevant documents at the time of the exam like Marriage Certificate / Divorce / Decree / Legal Name Change Document.

Unable to download the CMAT exam 2025 Admit Card?

  • Candidates must contact the helpline between 10 am to 5 pm for help in case they are unable to download the admit card of CMAT 2025 or mail cmat@nta.ac.in.
  • Candidates can also try clearing the browser cache and try again.

Steps to take in case of discrepancy in CMAT 2025 exam admit card

  • Candidates who find any discrepancy in the details mentioned on the CMAT exam admit card must call and mail the NTA helpline. 
  • They will be allowed to write CMAT 2025 with the downloaded admit card but will need to coordinate with NTA for correction.
  • While mailing NTA for corrections, candidates must attach a copy of their application form for the CMAT exam and the admit card to clearly indicate the discrepancies.

exam_name: IBSAT - IBS Aptitude Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
IBSAT exam: IBSAT or IBS Aptitude Test is a national-level entrance exam conducted by the ICFAI Foundation for Higher Education for admission into MBA/ PGPM programs. IBSAT exam score is accepted by its nine campuses, namely- IBS Hyderabad, IBS Bengaluru, IBS Mumbai, IBS Gurgaon, IBS Pune, IBS Ahmedabad, IBS Kolkata, IBS Dehradun, and IBS Jaipur. IBSAT is a two-hour Computer-based test (CBT) comprising multiple-choice questions. IBSAT is a computer-based test conducted in a window of two days, this year IBSAT exam is scheduled to be held on December 28 and 29, 2024. 

ICFAI Business School offers IBS MBA/PGPM admission to 9 IBS campuses based on IBSAT score. ICFAI Business School has started IBSAT exam registration 2024 on July 1. Candidates can complete the IBSAT 2024 application form by visiting the official website- ibsindia.org. The IBSAT exam registration last date will be the third week of December 2024. The IBSAT exam fee is around Rs. 1,800. The IBSAT exam date 2024 is December 28 and 29, 2024. IBS has activated the National Mock Test (NMT) on its official site. Candidates who going to appear for the IBSAT exam 2024, can take the IBSAT mock test from August 31 to December 7.

ICFAI Business School have updated the IBSAT selection process, instead of Group Discussion (GD) authorities will now conduct Micro Presentation and Personal Interview (PI). The IBSAT exam syllabus includes Quantitative techniques, Data interpretation and data adequacy, Reading comprehension and Verbal Ability. Besides the IBSAT scorecard, candidates can also apply for admission to ICFAI-affiliated colleges based on CAT/ NMAT by GMAC/ GMAT /XAT scores.

National level entrance exam score requirement for IBSAT exempted category:

  • CAT score of 60 percentile and above
  • NMAT by GMAC™ score of 150 and above
  • XAT score of 60 percentile and above
  • GMAT™ score of 500 and above

ICFAI Business School, Hyderabad will conduct IBSAT 2024 entrance test on December 28 and 29. The authorities will announce the IBSAT exam results in the first week of January 2025. After the declaration of IBSAT exam result, shortlisted candidates will have to appear for the IBSAT selection process rounds which consist of Group Discussion (GD) and Personal Interview (PI). It is expected that IBSAT GD-PI will be held probably in February 2025 at the Hyderabad campus. ICFAI Business School conducts IBSAT entrance test for admission into MBA/ PGPM courses in its 9 campuses.

As per the eligibility criteria of the IBSAT exam 2024, candidates must have completed their graduation in any discipline from a recognized institute/ university with at least 50% aggregate marks. The computer-based test of two hours duration had objective-type questions from areas like Verbal Ability, Quantitative Techniques, Data Interpretation and Data sufficiency, and Reasoning Ability.

Going by the past trends, the expected cut-off for admission in the top IBSAT score accepting B-School - ICFAI Hyderabad is likely to remain 85+ percentile.  

What is the IBSAT Exam?

IBSAT is one of the popular examinations for post-graduate management entrance. IBSAT is conducted for admission to post-graduate management courses offered at various campuses of IBS. IBSAT is conducted by ICFAI Business School every year. The exam assesses the applicant’s ability in quantitative techniques, data interpretation, data adequacy, vocabulary, analytical reasoning, and reading comprehension.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The ICFAI Business School will specify the IBSAT exam eligibility criteria for the aspirant to appear for the IBS Aptitude Test 2024 in the official notification. Before filling out the application form, applicants must check the IBSAT exam eligibility criteria.

Highlights of IBSAT Exam Eligibility Criteria

  • Minimum Marks Required - To fill out the application form for IBSAT exam, candidates will be required to complete their graduation with a minimum of 50% marks in total aggregate.
  • Educational Qualification - Candidates should have done their 15 years of education in the pattern of 10+2+3 or 10+2+4.
  • Required medium of education - Candidates must have done their Bachelor’s in English medium. If they are not from English medium, in such case candidates need to submit TOEFL/ IELT/ IELTS score
  • Those candidates who are pursuing their final year of graduation and willing to appear for the IBSAT exam, can fill out the IBSAT application form, but later on, such candidates will have to produce their graduation certificate.
  • Age limit - There is no age bar to apply for IBSAT entrance exam.
  • Nationality - As per past year trends, only Indian citizens are allowed to fill out the application form for IBSAT exam. Those who do not have Indian citizenship, will not be allowed to register for IBSAT.
  • Candidates can also apply through CAT, GMAT, and NMAT by GMAC score for direct admission.

application_process.html_content:
ICFAI Business School begins the IBSAT exam registration on July 1, 2024. Candidates are required to visit the ICFAI Business School official website to fill out the IBSAT registration form. It is expected that IBSAT application form will be available till the third week of December 2024.

At the time of filling IBSAT registration form, candidates will have to enter their personal as well as past academic details. Also, candidates can purchase the IBSAT exam application form at any of the marketing offices by paying the requisite IBSAT exam fee in cash. 

While filling out the application form for IBSAT exam, candidates will have to pay the IBSAT exam fee of Rs 1,800, as well as candidates, need to upload all the requisite documents.

Guidelines to Fill IBSAT exam application form 2024

  • Candidates will have to enter their personal details (like name, DOB, contact information like mobile number, email address, residential address, etc.) and academic details like educational qualifications while filling out the IBSAT application form.
  • Recent passport-size coloured photographs in the specified format must be uploaded.
  • Specify the exam whose score will be used to apply for the programme (either through IBSAT or GMAT, CAT or NMAT by GMAC).
  • Check if all the information entered is accurate and click on ‘I Agree.’
  • View all the information entered and schedule the IBSAT exam 2024.

Steps to fill out IBSAT application form 2024

Candidates can refer to the following steps while filling out the application form for IBSAT.

Step 1 - Visit the official website of ICFAI Business School i.e. www.ibsindia.org
Step 2 - Click register for IBSAT and enter all the details without waiting till the IBSAT last date to apply 2024.
Step 3 - Preview the IBSAT application form and re-check all the information
Step 4 - Pay the IBSAT exam fees
Step 5 - After paying the application fee, “Submit” the application form and take a printout of it for future reference.

preparation_tips.html_content:
While preparing for the IBSAT exam, candidates should allow at least three months for IBSAT exam preparation. Be thorough will all the topics from Verbal Ability, Reading Comprehension, Data Interpretation and Adeqquancy, and Quantitative Aptitude. Check out the useful preparation tips for the IBSAT exam 2024.

  • Work on your fundamentals and be updated.
  • Apart from IBSAT preparation books candidates should solve the past year's IBSAT sample paper and the previous year's question paper.
  • Take the IBSAT mock test regularly.
  • Join online and offline study groups while preparing for IBSAT exam.

admit_card.html_content:
Only registered candidates will be able to download the IBSAT admit card or hall ticket from the official website of IBS after they book their test slots. To book the test slot and download the admit card of IBSAT, candidates need to enter the application number and password which they will receive at their registered email address. 

Steps to download IBSAT exam admit card 2024

Candidates can refer to the following steps while downloading IBSAT exam admit card.

Apart from the admit card of IBSAT exam, candidates must carry along a valid photo ID proof such as an Aadhaar card, voter ID, driving license, etc. to the exam centre.

This list will have the names of qualifying candidates who have secured the minimum marks or percentile required to get shortlisted for the selection process. The cutoff for the IBSAT exam will vary from institute to institute.

All the IBS campuses will release the minimum cutoff marks for IBSAT 2024 after the declaration of results. In order to be eligible for the IBSAT selection procedure, candidates will have to secure minimum cutoff marks. Those who will meet the specified IBSAT cutoff criteria, such candidates will have to participate in further selection rounds. Authorities will consider certain factors while preparing IBSAT cutoff criteria.

exam_name: SNAP - Symbiosis National Aptitude Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The SNAP exam is conducted for MBA admission to the 17 Symbiosis Colleges affiliated with SIU. The SNAP exam 2024 will be conducted by Symbiosis International (Deemed University) on December 8, 15, and 21, 2024. Candidates who are looking for admission to MBA/PGDM programmes at SIU must appear for the SNAP entrance exam 2024. The application window for SNAP exam 2024 opened on August 5, 2024, at snaptest.org. Candidates can fill out the online SNAP exam application form by November 22, 2024. The SIU will conduct the SNAP exam 2024 mock test on October 4, 2024. Candidates who have paid the fee for SNAP 2024 by September 30, 12 midnight, are eligible for the mock test. Last year, over 1.42 lakh candidates appeared for the Symbiosis National Aptitude Test (SNAP). Learn all about SNAP 2024.

Key Facts for SNAP Exam 2024

  • SNAP 2024 mock test will be held on October 4, 2024.
  • SNAP exam 2024 registration began on August 5, 2024, and the SNAP application window will be closed on November 22, 2024.
  • An admit card for the SNAP exam will be issued on December 2, 9, and 15, 2024.
  • SIU will conduct the SNAP exam 2024 on three different dates, i.e., December 8, 15, and 21, 2024.
  • Candidates can appear for all three SNAP exam slots.
  • The SNAP exam result will be announced on January 8, 2025.
  • 16 Symbiosis colleges will accept SNAP exam score to offer admission into MBA programme.

Snapshot of official SNAP exam 2024 website

SNAP Exam 2024: Key Highlights

SNAP FeaturesDetails

SNAP exam conducting bodySymbiosis International (Deemed) University (SIU)
SNAP exam dateDecember 8, 15, and 21, 2024

SNAP exam modeOnline

  • Quantitative: Data Interpretation & Data Sufficiency
  • Analytical & Logical Reasoning

SNAP exam helpdesk number020-39116226
SNAP exam 2024 official websitesnaptest.org

What is SNAP Exam?

Symbiosis National Aptitude Test (SNAP) is a common admission test conducted by Symbiosis International (Deemed) University for admission to the PGDM and MBA programmes offered by its 17 constituent institutes. The SNAP exam is a speed-based test that comprises 60 questions from Quantitative-Data Interpretation & Data Sufficiency, Analytical & Logical Reasoning, and General English. Candidates who have completed a bachelor's degree with a minimum of 50% marks (45% for SC/ST) are eligible to apply for the SNAP exam 2024.

The SNAP 2024 is a computer-based test (CBT) that will be conducted in three sessions in an academic year at various examination centres in 84 cities across India. Candidates can take three attempts at the SNAP exam 2024. The best of three scores will be considered for SIU admission through SNAP 2024. The SNAP exam paper is divided into three sections, namely General English: Reading Comprehension, Verbal Reasoning, Verbal Ability, Quantitative, Data Interpretation & Data Sufficiency, and Analytical & Logical Reasoning. The duration of the SNAP test is one hour (60 minutes).

To qualify for admission, candidates must clear the SNAP exam 2024, Personal Interaction (PI), Written Ability Test (WAT), and Group Exercise (GE). This page has answers to all the common SNAP exam 2024 questions of the candidates regarding what the SNAP exam is, the start and end of the SNAP registration 2024 dates and the important SNAP exam date 2024. SIU will release the official notification for SNAP 2024 in online mode at snaptest.org.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
SIU will release the SNAP exam 2024 eligibility along with notification in online mode. Candidates must fulfill the following eligibility criteria to fill out the SNAP 2024 exam application form:

  • Students must have a bachelor's degree from a recognized university.
  • Candidates in the General category must have passed at least 50% of their Bachelor's degree.
  • Candidates from SC/ ST/ PWD/ DA should have a minimum of 45% marks in their Bachelor's Degree/ Certificate.
  • Those who have studied at a foreign (international) university are also eligible to apply for SNAP 2024. They need to get an AIU (Association of Indian Universities) certificate to fill out the SNAP exam form.
  • Final-year students can also apply for the SNAP exam.

Age Limit: As per the official eligibility criteria, there is no specification for the maximum age limit for the SNAP exam 2024.

NOTE: Aspirants should note that the eligibility for SNAP 2024 and MBA admission is different. Admission eligibility will be based on the MBA course and college chosen.

application_process.html_content:
Symbiosis International (Deemed) University, Pune, begins the SNAP registration 2024 online on August 5, 2024, at snaptest.org. The registration process for the SNAP exam 2024 will end on November 22, 2024. Candidates must fill out the SNAP application form, pay the fees, and attach all the required documents. 

Steps to fill SNAP Application Form 2024

Steps to Fill out the SNAP 2024 Application Form

Step 1 - Visit the official registration portal at snaptest.org.
Step 2 - Click on the new user tab "Register Here".
Step 3 - Read the terms and conditions and click on ‘I Agree’.
Step 4 - Re-login and fill out the SNAP registration form 2024.
Step 5 - Enter the OTP and validate your mobile no. Also, verify your email id.
Step 6 - Pay the SNAP registration fee.
Step 7 - Fill out Part II of the registration form along with the required details about your preferred SNAP colleges.
Step 8 - Make payment for the programmes/ colleges selected.

NOTE: Please note that after confirming your payment for SNAP Test 2024, the Symbiosis Test Secretariat will email your registered mail ID along with the confirmation of payment details. You will be able to see the SNAP admit card only after the payment is approved.

SNAP application fee: The application fee will be Rs. 2250 for each attempt at SNAP 2024. The programme/college fee (Rs. 1000/per programme/college) is to be paid only once for the Symbiosis National Aptitude Test (SNAP).

Documents Required for SNAP 2024 Registration

Candidates have to upload only their photo at the time of SNAP registration 2024 along with the application form details, which are mentioned below:

  • A valid ID Proof like a Driving license/ Pan card/ Voter ID card/ Aadhaar card
  • Contact number
  • Email ID
  • Scanned passport-size coloured photograph
  • Scanned signature
  • Class 10 mark sheet
  • Class 12 mark sheet
  • Graduation certificate

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates planning to appear for the SNAP 2024 exam should start preparing for it at least six months in advance. A good SNAP exam preparation plan should have three components: 

  • Syllabus through SNAP books
  • SNAP mock test practice, and

  • Revision for exam day. 

Know how to prepare for SNAP?

SNAP exam preparation is an important aspect. The seats are limited and competition is high. So students must prepare well for the SNAP symbiosis exam and try to get good scores to secure admission.

SNAP exam 2024 preparation requires knowledge of the SNAP exam pattern and insights into the SNAP exam syllabus. The SNAP 2024 mock test is another tool that can help aspirants get an idea of the exam.

Quick Tips to Crack SNAP 2024

How to crack SNAP, how to prepare for SNAP in a month, how to start SNAP preparation, how to crack SNAP in the first attempt, and more such questions pop up in your mind once you decide to appear for SNAP. Here are some quick SNAP 2024 preparation tips to ace this test;

  • Prepare as per the SNAP syllabus for all three sections. Download the SNAP syllabus pdf
  • Keep giving SNAP mock tests to keep track of your preparation and be aware of your strong and weak areas.
  • Pick up the best SNAP exam preparation material and best books for SNAP preparation
  • Prepare a SNAP exam 2024 preparation timetable and manage time well.
  • Focus on increasing speed and accuracy while solving questions
  • Solve questions of varying difficulty levels to boost confidence
  • Devise or learn shortcuts to solve Quantitative questions to solve them quickly and with no dependency on the calculator
  • You can also join online SNAP study groups to experience healthy competition

SNAP 2024 Exam Preparation Tips

  • The SNAP exam will consist of three sections: General English, Analytical & Logical Reasoning, and Quantitative, Data Interpretation & Data Sufficiency.
  • Candidates can use the common competitive and CAT preparation books for the SNAP 2024 exam.
  • The most important aspect of SNAP preparation is practice as speed is of the essence in the actual exam.

SNAP Preparation Guide - Exam Day Guidelines

According to the SNAP 2024 exam preparation guide, there are certain instructions that the students must follow on the day of the exam. Let us check the Dos and Don'ts for the SNAP exam 2024:

  • Ensure that you report at the SNAP exam centre at least one hour before the commencement of the exam
  • Make sure that you carry the SNAP admit card as entry will not be granted for those not carrying it
  • Any request for a change of SNAP 2024 test centre will not be entertained at any cost
  • Along with the SNAP exam admit card, it is essential to carry any one of the following valid photo identity proof such as-
    • Passport
    • Voter Id card
    • Aadhaar Card or E-Aadhaar card printout
    • PAN Card, etc
  • Biometric data will be taken at the test centre; hence, female candidates must not apply henna on their hands.

admit_card.html_content:
Symbiosis International (Deemed) University will issue the SNAP 2024 exam admit card online on December 2, 9, and 15, 2024, respectively. Candidates will download the admit card for the SNAP test 2024 at snaptest.org. To download the SNAP exam 2024 hall ticket, students must enter their valid SNAP ID and password.

Steps to download the SNAP exam 2024 admit card

  • Log on to the official SNAP website - snaptest.org.
  • Click on the ‘SNAP Exam Admit Card Download’ tab on the homepage.
  • Enter your valid SNAP ID and Password.
  • SNAP 2024 exam admit card will appear on the screen.
  • Download the admit card for SNAP exam 2024 and take a printout of the same.

Admit card for the SNAP entrance exam 2024 is the most important document for any candidate who wants to take the SNAP test. Without a SNAP exam admit card, no candidate would be allowed to enter the examination centre.

When the candidates download the SNAP exam 2024 admit card, they need to check some important details in it. If these details are missing, candidates are advised to inform the examination authorities on an urgent basis and correct the admit card for SNAP exam.

Important details to check in the SNAP 2024 admit card

  • Candidate’s name
  • SNAP ID of the candidate
  • Photograph of the candidate
  • Candidate’s signature
  • Date of birth
  • SNAP 2024 seat number
  • Reporting time
  • SNAP 2024 test centre

Students are asked to carry certain documents with them in SNAP 2024. These documents are listed below:

  • Aadhaar card
  • Voter ID card
  • Passport
  • Driving License
  • Pan card

cutoffs.html_content:
The minimum marks or percentile required to be shortlisted for the selection is the cutoff for the SNAP 2024 exam. There are 17 SNAP colleges that accept the test scores for admission. Each institute prescribes a different SNAP cutoff depending on their admission requirements.

The SNAP exam colleges will display the respective category-wise SNAP exam cutoff 2024 on their websites for the purpose of shortlisting. The SNAP waitlist will depend on the vacant seats available.

Factors Determining the SNAP exam 2024 Cutoff

The factors that led to the determination of the SNAP 2024 exam cut off are:

  • Number of candidates who appeared for SNAP exam
  • The difficulty level of SNAP 2024
  • Number of candidates who qualified in the SNAP exam
  • Number of seats available in each SNAP college

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The SNAP 2024 exam pattern will be prescribed by SIU as per the below-mentioned. Candidates must go through the SNAP symbiosis exam pattern thoroughly.

  • There will be only multiple-choice questions, and the total number of questions is 60.
  • The time to solve the SNAP 2024 exam questions will be 1 hour (60 minutes).
  • The SNAP exam timings will be 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM and 4:30 PM to 5:30 PM.

exam_name: MUCMET - Mumbai University Common Management Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description: Mumbai University Common Management Entrance Test (MUCMET) is conducted by University of Mumbai every year for admission to Integrated BMS+MBA course offered at Mumbai’s Thane Sub Campus. The state-level exam will be conducted in paper-pencil mode. In order to appear for the exam, candidates must have passed Higher Secondary/Intermediate or equivalent from a recognized board with minimum 45% (40% for reserved category) in any stream. Interested candidates can fill the application of MUCMET 2023 in online mode. As per the exam pattern prescribed by Mumbai University, MUCMET 2023 will be held for a duration of two hours and will consist of 100 questions. Post MUCMET 2023, a merit list will be released and the successful candidates can seek admission on the basis of same.

highlights.value: Mumbai University Common Management Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
• Candidates must have cleared their Higher Secondary School Certificate / Intermediate (10+2) or its equivalent certificate from a recognized Board

  • They must have scored a minimum of 45% aggregate (40% aggregate in case of Reserved category) from Science, Commerce, Arts or any other stream / discipline

  • They should be below 20 years of age (22 years in case of Reserved category and PWD candidates)

  • 85% seats in MU for BMS-MBA programme at Thane sub-campus shall be reserved for the students qualified and domiciled in Maharashtra

application_process.html_content:
Interested candidates should apply through the prescribed form available on the official website: of MU along with the Demand Draft of any nationalized bank in favour of “Finance and Accounts Officer, University of Mumbai”. The application process of MUCMET 2023 has been started on the official website.

How to apply for MUCMET 2023?

  • Visit the Mumbai University website and select Thane Sub Campus tab. On the new page, the candidate will find BMS-MBA (Integrated) link which will take them to the MUCMET application form.

  • MUCMET 2023 registration form must be submitted by post or in person before the deadline along with relevant documents and a demand draft of Rs 500 (Rs 250 for Reserved category students) drawn in favour of Finance and Accounts Officer, University of Mumbai.

  • Candidate must send the relevant documents along with the form and the demand draft at the following address:

University of Mumbai,

Thane Sub Campus

Balkum, Thane (West)-400608

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
MUCMET comprises Multiple Choice questions in the areas of Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension, Quantitative Aptitude, Logical/Abstract Reasoning, and General Awareness. In all, there would be a total of 100 questions to be answered and the total time allotted is 2 hours (120 minutes). All answered need to be marked using a black ball-point pen as the mode of answering is offline mode. For every correct answer, candidate will be awarded one mark. Negative marking of 0.25 marks or 1/4th of the marks allotted to a question will be deducted for each incorrect response.

exam_name: NMAT - NMAT by GMAC

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
NMAT exam registration will be closed on October 10. Eligible candidates can fill out the NMAT exam form by visiting the official website- mba.com. As per NMAT 2024 exam schedule, the NMAT exam scheduling window is open till October 14. As per NMAT exam schedule, the same will be held from November 5 to December 20. Those who are looking for MBA admission in the academic batch of 2025-27 can appear for NMAT exam 2024 thrice during test window. The NMAT 2024 exam window has been reduced to 45 days.  Candidates can complete the NMAT registration before the NMAT registration last date. NMAT exam is quite easier than the CAT, most of the students who prepare for the CAT entrance test can easily crack the NMAT. GMAC will conduct the NMAT exam in the 70-day long window. More than 50+ top B-schools in India accept NMAT exam scores for admission into the MBA program. The NMAT exam cutoff percentile between 85 to 95 will get candidates to NMIMS campuses like NMIMS Bangalore, Navi Mumbai, Hyderabad, and Indore.

NMAT by GMAC 2024

While preparing for the NMAT exam, a candidate needs to dedicate 4 to 5 hours daily to cover the entire NMAT exam syllabus. Also, while preparing for this national-level MBA entrance exam, candidates should take the NMAT exam mock test regularly and solve the previous year's NMAT exam question paper. MBA aspirants usually search for Is NMAT tougher than CAT? So for them, the answer is that the NMAT exam is quite easier than the CAT exam, and most of the candidates who prepare for the CAT exam can easily attempt the NMAT and secure a decent percentile.

Going by past year's trends, the NMAT exam difficulty level is easy to moderate. Candidates who want to score well in the NMAT exam 2024 should know about the latest NMAT exam pattern. The NMAT exam 2024 paper will have 108 questions and the time to solve them is 120 minutes (2 hours). The NMAT by GMAC exam score is based on the performance of the candidates in three sections: language skills, quantitative aptitude, and logical reasoning.

Latest Update on NMAT Exam 2024

  • As per the official website of the NMAT by GMAC exam, authorities announced the entire schedule of NMAT 2024. Candidates can check the NMAT exam 2024 schedule at mba.com/exams/nmat.
  • The NMAT 2024 question paper will have a total of 108 questions from three sections namely; Logical Reasoning, Quantitative Skills, and Language Skills.
  • The Graduate Management Admission Council (GMAC) activated the NMAT 2024 registration link on August 1, 2024.

The Graduate Management Admission Council (GMAC) conducts the NMAT, a significant national-level MBA entrance exam. Every year, around 75,000 aspirants appear for the NMAT entrance exam. The NMAT exam is conducted over 70 days starting from November 5 to December 20,2 024. Candidates can appear in the NMAT exam 2024 three times, i.e., in one attempt and two retakes.

Candidates should check the respective websites of the business schools to understand the eligibility criteria and admission process through the NMAT exam 2024 by GMAC score. Candidates who register for the NMAT by GMAC exam must also fill out the application for B-schools separately. Candidates can select and send scores to colleges in India, South Africa, the Philippines, and Nigeria.

What is NMAT by GMAC?

The NMIMS Management Aptitude Test (NMAT Exam) is a national-level MBA entrance test conducted by the Graduate Management Admission Council (GMAC) for admission to NMIMS Mumbai and other top MBA colleges. Candidates can attempt the NMAT exam conducted by GMAC up to three times, i.e., one attempt and 2 retakes. The candidates can take retake attempts with a gap of 15 days each. In addition to this, the students also have the facility to reschedule the date and time according to their convenience within the 70-day test window.

NMAT by GMAC exam is a mandatory entrance test for MBA admission to NMIMS Mumbai and its other campuses, as well as 50+ other MBA colleges like NMIMS Mumbai, SPJIMR Mumbai, ISB, VIT University, K J Somaiya Institute of Management, IFMR, SRM University, UPES, ITM Business School, IFIM College, to name a few.

It must be noted that earlier the conducting body of the NMAT exam was NMIMS, Mumbai, but now GMAC has taken over the responsibility to conduct this exam.

What is NMAT exam full form?

The full form of NMAT is the NMIMS Management Aptitude Test (NMAT), conducted by the Graduate Management Admission Council (GMAC) for admission to NMIMS Mumbai and other top MBA colleges. 

Who all are eligible for the NMAT exam?

To take the NMAT exam, candidates must meet the eligibility criteria, which GMAC sets. The NMAT exam eligibility criteria differ from college to college. Here we have listed detailed NMAT 2024 exam eligibility.

  • Candidates should have completed their graduation degree in any stream.
  • Candidates should have scored 50% marks in the total aggregate and there is a relaxation of 5% marks in cases where candidates belong to reserved category.
  • There is no upper age limit to appear for the NMAT exam.

Things to know about the NMAT exam 2024

  • NMAT Eligibility: As per the NMAT exam eligibility, those who have completed their graduation with 50% (45% for SC/ ST/ PWD category) are eligible to apply for the NMAT 2024 exam. 
  • NMAT exam syllabus:  The NMAT exam syllabus includes Language skills, Quantitative skills, and Logical Reasoning. 
  • How much does an NMAT exam cost?: The NMAT exam fee for all category candidates is Rs 2800 plus applicable taxes.

NMAT Exam 2024- Key points to keep in mind

  • At the time of NMAT exam registration, candidates will have to upload a scanned copy of government-approved ID proof. 
  • Also, candidates need to set up three security questions for MFA purposes. Before the exam, one of these three questions will be asked to ensure authenticity. 
  • Many times, candidates end up choosing the wrong time zone. Candidates are required to choose the right time zone because candidates would not be able to alter it.
  • Candidates will be able to download the admit card from your dashboard.

People also ask about the NMAT exam 2024

Question- Is NMAT tougher than CAT?

Answer- As per the difficulty level of both national-level MBA entrance exams, the NMAT is much easier than the CAT, and most of the candidates who prepare for the CAT entrance test can easily attempt the NMAT exam. So, if a candidate is well prepared for the CAT, they can easily crack the NMAT. 

Question- Is 199 a good score in NMAT?

Answer- Securing 199 marks in NMAT is indeed good. Score around 200 score in NMAT can fetch candidates 90+ percentile.

Question- Does NMAT have negative marks?

Answer- As per NMAT exam marking scheme, there is no negative marking for wrong or unattempted answers.

Question- Which MBA college accepts NMAT exam score?

Answer- NMAT exam scorecard is accepted by many top B-schools such as Xavier School of Human Resource Management, SVKM's Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies, Xavier School of Sustainability and many more.

NMAT Exam Scheduling 2024

The Graduate Management Admission Council (GMAC) is the conducting body on NMAT. At the time of NMAT application form submission, candidates will have to schedule their NMAT exam as per their choice. During the NMAT exam scheduling window, candidates will be required to specify the date and NMAT exam city where they wish to take the NMAT exam. Only candidates who successfully schedule the NMAT exam will be allowed to appear for the test. In order to access the NMAT exam scheduling option, candidates are required to login to the NMAT dashboard.

NMAT Exam Pattern 2024

While preparing for NMAT exam, it is important to have a clear idea about the NMAT paper pattern. Here’s a brief overview of the NMAT Exam Pattern which consists of three sections:

Section nameNumber of questionsTime limitScore range

It’s very important to have a clear idea of what the exam looks like before actually planning to take it in order to have a better understanding of the paper which in turn leads to more effective preparation.

What is the NMAT exam syllabus?

Here we have provided a section-wise NMAT exam syllabus along with important topics.

Section nameNMAT exam syllabus along with important topics
Language SkillsEnglish Grammar, Reading Comprehension, Word Meaning and Verbal Ability
Logical ReasoningCritical Reasoning, Coding-Decoding, Puzzles, Statement Conclusions, Blood Relations, etc

People also ask about the NMAT exam syllabus

Question- Is the NMAT exam easy?

Answer- The NMAT exam is a computer-based test conducted by GMAC. The NMAT entrance exam is considered quite moderate as compared to other MBA entrance exams. 

Question- Is GK asked in NMAT exam?

Answer- There is no General Knowledge (GK) section in NMAT exam. NMAT exam has only three sections.

Question- Can I join NMIMS without NMAT?

Answer- No, candidates cannot join the Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies (NMIMS) without an NMAT exam. To get an admission to NMIMS, candidates should appear for NMAT.

NOTE: In case of more than one attempt, scores of the NMAT exam to be considered by colleges will be based on their respective eligibility criteria. Candidates are advised to check the NMAT eligibility criteria and decide accordingly before applying.

NMAT Exam Preparation Tips

  • Put efforts on basics- It the candidate's concepts are clear that means they do not have to worry much. Candidates need to revise their strengths and put more effort into their weaknesses. Candidates are also advised to go through the whole NMAT exam syllabus and practice accordingly.
  • Make a section-wise strategy- NMAT exam paper consist of total 3 sections namely- language skill, quantitative ability, and logical reasoning.
  • Focus on speed, time, and accuracy rate- NMAT exam is quite time consuming test. The total number of questions in the NMAT exam will be 120 which should be solved within 120 minutes.

NMAT Previous year question paper and sample paper

By solving NMAT previous year question paper and sample paper, they will get an insight of the exam. Also, candidates will get to know the difficulty level of NMAT exam sections, and variations in questions and pattern over the past few years. In order to appear for the MBA admission process on the basis of the NMAT exam scorecard, candidates are required to meet the sectional and overall NMAT cutoff. Checkout the NMAT exam 2024 expected sectional cutoff.

NMAT Exam Result and Selection Process

Graduate Management Admission Council™ (GMAC) announces NMAT exam results within 48 hours of the exam. Candidates can check their NMAT exam score by using the required login credentials that they have generated at the time of NMAT registration. After the declaration of the NMAT exam result, the selection process will take place. NMAT exam selection process includes Group Discussion (GD) and Personal Interview (PI) conducted by the participating institutes. 

Question- When will the NMAT exam result be declared?

Answer- Candidates will be able to see their unofficial NMAT exam scorecard right after the completion of test. Candidates will receive their NMAT scorecard with scaled score for the sections. The official NMAT exam scorecard will be generated within 48 hours of taking the exam.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Graduate Management Admission Council (GMAC) will specify the eligibility criteria for the NMAT exam 2024 on its official website. Check out below who is eligible and who is not to appear for the NMAT exam 2024.

Who is eligible for NMAT exam 2024?

Academic Qualifications:

  • Applicants should have a bachelor’s degree in any discipline from a recognized university or institute with at least 50 percent marks.
  • The final-year students pursuing their bachelor’s degree (regular) can also appear for NMAT 2024 and will be given provisional admission only if they pass their bachelor's with 50% and qualify for the NMAT exam 2024.

Age Limit: The NMAT by GMAC exam has no age restrictions.

Work experience: Candidates need not have work experience to appear for the NMAT exam. However, candidates with work experience of two or more years will be given preference in MBA admissions through NMAT.

NOTE: The above-given criteria are to appear for the NMAT exam by GMAC. The eligibility criteria for admissions will vary with the institute applying to. Candidates are therefore advised to check the same carefully before applying.

preparation_tips.html_content:
The NMAT exam is a crucial step for aspirants who wish to pursue management courses in NMAT colleges in India. Preparing for the NMAT exam requires a combination of strategy, focus, and hard work. Here are some preparation tips for the NMAT exam:

  1. Create a study plan: It is essential to create a study plan and allocate sufficient time for each topic according to the NMAT syllabus. This will help you stay focused and cover all the topics within the given time.
  2. Understand the exam pattern: The NMAT exam pattern consists of language skills, quantitative skills, and logical reasoning. Understanding the exam pattern thoroughly will help you know what to expect and prepare accordingly.
  3. Practise previous year question papers: Practising previous year NMAT question papers will help you understand the type of questions that are asked in NMAT exam and also help you identify your strengths and weaknesses.
  4. Focus on speed and accuracy: The NMAT exam is time-bound, and it is essential to focus on speed and accuracy while solving the questions. Practise regularly to improve your speed and accuracy.
  5. Take mock tests: Taking NMAT mock tests will help you evaluate your performance and identify areas where you need to improve. It will also help you get used to the exam environment.
  6. Stay updated with current affairs: The language skills section of the NMAT exam 2024 will have questions related to current affairs. Stay updated with current events by reading newspapers, magazines, and online news portals.

Preparing for the NMAT exam requires a well-planned approach and regular practice. With the right strategy and hard work, one can crack the exam and pursue their dreams of a career in management.

NMAT 2024: Tips to follow while taking test 

Besides the above proven tips to crack the NMAT exam, there are some other tips that the candidates must follow in order to take the exam smoothly. Here are some important exam-related guidelines to follow.

  • Candidates must first check their system/ computer readiness. They need to do so as per the rules mentioned here
  • They must be alone in the room where they chose to give the NMAT exam.
  • The desk and nearby area should be clutter free and clean and must be visible clearly during NMAT by GMAC 2024.
  • The system must be connected to a power source
  • No phones, headphones, calculator or any electronic devices should be present in the NMAT exam room.
  • No dual monitors will be allowed so candidates must ensure this.
  • Candidates cannot leave their seats during the NMAT exam 2024.
  • They must avoid talking or reading aloud the questions while writing NMAT exam 2024.
  • Webcam, speakers, and microphone must remain on throughout the NMAT test.
  • Ears should be visible throughout the exam.
  • All open applications in the system must be closed before the NMAT exam starts.
  • Candidates must ensure that all pop-up blockers are turned off while writing NMAT 2024
  • They should not be connected to VPN
  • They must allow a 360-degree view of the room for the proctor during the NMAT exam.
  • 2 A4 blank sheets and a pencil have to be shown to the proctor before the exam starts. These must be torn in front of the proctor once the NMAT 2024 exam is completed. 
  • Pens are strictly not allowed for the test.

  • In the event of a computer malfunction/connectivity issue during NMAT at the candidate's end, the proctor will help/guide the candidates to resume the exam within half an hour (30 mins). In case the issue is not resolved by then, candidates will have to schedule another attempt. The fee for the incomplete attempt will be forfeited.

NMAT Study material

Most of the subjects asked and the NMAT syllabus shows that candidates need not buy separate books for NMAT exam 2024 preparation. The books used for CAT preparation will suffice for the NMAT preparation too. In fact, these books will also help. In addition practice with various mock tests will also add to better preparation for NMAT by GMAC.

admit_card.html_content:
GMAC will release the NMAT exam 2024 admit card within 24 hours after the scheduling of the NMAT test by registered candidates as soon as they make the NMAT exam fee payment. Candidates must schedule the NMAT exam date and time before printing their NMAT admit card.

Candidates can also use the NMAT by GMAC login to download their admit card. The details mentioned in the NMAT exam admit card include registration details and photographs. Candidates have to produce the NMAT admit card along with two photo ids at the NMAT entrance exam centre on the NMAT test date.

How to download the NMAT admit card?

  • Go to the official website i.e. nmat.org .
  • Click on the NMAT login and enter the email, mobile number, and password.
  • Click the “admit card” button to download the NMAT admit card
  • Only students who have scheduled their NMAT test date and time can download the admit card.
  • After downloading the admit card, check the details
  • Download and take a printout of the same for the home-proctored test. Candidates appearing for the test in an exam centre can download and show the same on their mobile devices.

Details mentioned on NMAT hall ticket

The following details will be mentioned on the admit card for the NMAT exam:

  • Candidate name & ID
  • Photograph
  • Mother's or Father’s name
  • Date of birth
  • Gender
  • Photo ID proofs
  • Signature proof
  • Nationality
  • Exam attempt details
  • Retake details (2 attempts) if taken

  • Important instructions for NMAT exam

Documents to carry to the NMAT test centre

Candidates must carry the following list of documents to the NMAT exam centre:

  • Confirmation email print out / can be shown in mobile also
  • NMAT by GMAC admit card
  • One valid photo ID like passport/ PAN card/ Voter's ID/ UID/ Aadhaar card
  • Signature ID in original form like passport/ PAN card/ Debit/ Credit card/ Driver's license

  • Specified documents for PwD candidates

NMAT exam slot booking

Candidates who complete the NMAT registration can proceed to book the exam slots, also known as exam scheduling. Candidates can choose the exam slot from the available test centres in a particular location using the NMAT scheduling window. NMAT admit card can be downloaded within 24 hours of booking slots. 

NMAT exam admit card 2024- Important instructions

  • After downloading the NMAT exam admit card, candidates should check whether the printed photograph of the candidate is visible or not. In case a candidate finds the photograph section blank or not visible then in such case candidates need to contact the helpdesk number.
  • On the day of the NMAT exam, candidates will have to show their NMAT exam admit card along with a confirmation email. 
  • Along with the NMAT exam admit card, candidates are also required to present their one valid photo ID proof in original.

exam_name: MAT - Management Aptitude Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
MAT exam 2024 will be conducted in CBT, IBT, and PBT modes. The registration process for MAT exam 2024 December session has begin in online mode on September 6. Candidates can fill out the AIMA MAT 2024 application form at mat.aima.in. The MAT exam registration process for CBT 1 will be closed on November 30, PBT will end on December 7, and CBT 1 will end on December 15. The MAT exam question paper consists of 200 MCQs from five sections: Language Comprehension, Data Analysis & Sufficiency, Mathematical Skills, Intelligence & Critical Reasoning, and Indian & Global Environment. Candidates will be able to download the MAT Scorecard from the MAT 2024 official website (applicant dashboard).

What is the MAT exam?

The Management Aptitude Test (MAT) is a standardized test conducted since 1988 that helps business schools (B-schools) screen applicants for admission to PGDM/MBA and allied programs. The Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, recognized MAT as a national-level examination in 2003. 

Any B-school, national or international, can consider the MAT score as an admission input based on the scorecards issued to the candidates. The largest test in the country, MAT will continue to be your passport to over 600 B-schools across India. Around 20,000 candidates appear for the MAT exam in every session.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
AIMA has specified the eligibility criteria for MAT exam 2024. Candidates who are going to appear for the exam must meet the eligibility criteria as laid by the AIMA. There is no age bar, candidates of any age can appear for MAT exam. Check below the detailed MAT eligibility criteria.

  • To apply for the examination, as per the MAT eligibility criteria 2024, a candidate must have completed graduation in any discipline from a recognized institute or university.
  • Even final-year graduation students from any stream can apply for the exam. AIMA hasn’t mentioned any age limit for the exam. 
  • Interestingly, one can appear for the exam as many times as he/she wants.
  • There is no specific age limit for MAT exam date 2024.

application_process.html_content:
All India Management Association (AIMA) started the December cycle applications for the MAT exam 2024 in online mode. The MAT registration 2024 dates for PBT, CBT, and IBT modes are different. Keep this in mind while filling out the MAT application 2024 form online at the official website. Here are some important things to know before registering for the MAT exam.

MAT Application Form 2024- Web Browser Recommended

The following are the recommended web browsers to avoid technical glitches while filling out the MAT application form,

  • Google Chrome 3.0
  • Internet Explorer 9 or above

  • Firefox - Latest Version

What to keep ready before filling out the MAT 2024 application form?

  • Valid Email ID 
  • Scanned photograph in jpg/jpeg format with size not more than 100 KB and not less than 40 KB
  • Scanned signature in jpg/jpeg format with size not more than 40 KB and not less than 10KB
  • Debit/ Credit Card/ Net Banking details
  • Personal details
  • Educational qualification details

How to fill out MAT Application Form 2024:

  • 1st Step: Register by providing the necessary details.  
  • 2nd Step: Log in using email, password, and date of birth, and click on the “Submit” button.
  • 3rd Step: Fill Registration Form & Choices for Management Institutes(MI).
  • Candidates can select as many MIs on payment of an additional fee of Rs 118.
  • 4th Step: Upload Photo and Signature - photograph (20KB to 150 KB) and signature (20KB to 150 KB)
  • 5th Step: Make Payment of the registration fee through Debit / Credit Card / Net Banking.

  • 6th Step: View/Download the Registration form and take a printout
  • 7th Step: Update details if required. After downloading and reviewing the registration form, the candidate can edit a few specific details.

admit_card.html_content:
AIMA will issue the MAT 2024 admit card for the December session in online mode. The MAT exam admit card will be available on various dates based on the exam date. Candidates can download the MAT exam admit card by logging into their dashboard, using a registered email ID and password. AIMA will not send a hard copy of the MAT exam 2024 admit card to any candidate. 

Details like the name of the candidate, photograph, signature, date of the exam, the name of the venue and address, etc. are mentioned on the MAT 2024 admit card. The hall ticket is a must-have document, as no candidate is allowed to appear for the exam without the admit card of MAT 2024.

How to download MAT Admit Card 2024 (CBT/ PBT/ IBT Mode):

Follow the steps below to download the MAT admit card:

  • Open the official AIMA MAT website, mat.aima.in.
  • Log in to the candidate's dashboard, using the registered email ID and password.
  • Click on the view and download the MAT admit card.
  • Download it as a PDF file and take a printout of the same. 
  • Keep it safe for future reference.

  • A Digital photocopy of the MAT admit card 2024 will not be considered a valid ID proof
  • It is mandatory for candidates to carry the original copy of the admit card.

cutoffs.html_content:
The B-schools that accept MAT scores will shortlist the candidates as per their prescribed cutoff criteria. The MAT participating institutes will release their cut-off for MAT 2024 as soon as the MAT result is announced. Basically, the candidates who meet the cutoff criterion are shortlisted for the selection process. 

The MAT 2024 cut off can either be in the form of a percentile or marks. The cutoff score ranges from 250 to 700 and varies from institute to institute. The cutoff depends on various factors, including the Difficulty level of the test, the total number of test-takers, the total number of seats offered by an institute, etc.

MAT Cutoff: Participating Institutes

The MAT cut off of B-schools will be based on several factors, such as score in MAT exam, number of test takers, previous year cutoff, etc. Those who meet the cutoff will be shortlisted for the selection/admission process. The MAT 2024 cut off will be released in the form of score.

about_exam.description:
CAT exam 2024 form correction window activated in online mode. Candidates who have entered their data incorrectly in the CAT exam form can correct it by September 30, at 5 pm. Candidates name, signature, and exam center can be edited only in the CAT 2024 exam application form. After the closure of the correction window, the IIM Calcutta will issue the CAT exam 2024 admit card. Candidates who submitted the CAT exam form, can download their hall ticket from November 5, 2024. Candidates can download it in online mode at iimcat.ac.in. The CAT 2024 exam date is November 24, 2024. The CAT exam will be conducted in three shifts in over 170 cities across India. This year, the CAT exam will be conducted by IIM Calcutta. This CAT exam is an important step in facilitating admission to 21 IIMs and other MBA colleges in India.

Common Admission Test 2024

CAT exam is the most popular among all the MBA entrance exams conducted once a year. The CAT exam is the minimum eligibility criteria to get admission to IIMs and other top Bschools. Candidates who want to get admission into an MBA /PGDM programme must appear in the CAT exam. To predict interview and admission calls from all IIMs and other top MBA colleges based on students' CAT exam scores, please refer to Careers360's CAT College Predictor Tool. 

CAT Exam 2024 Latest Updates & News

Recently, the Indian Institute of Management (IIM), Calcutta, has alerted the candidates about the existence of a fake website on the official CAT 2024 registration portal. The CAT notification states that the official website for CAT exam 2024 registration is iimcat.ac.in advertised in reliable newspapers.

  • CAT Exam Date: Sunday, November 24, 2024 (Three Shifts: Morning, Afternoon, Evening)
  • CAT Exam Form Correction: Tentatively from September 26 to 29, 2024
  • CAT Registration: August 1 to September 13, 2024 September 20, 2024
  • CAT Admit card release: November 5, 2024
  • CAT Result declaration: Second week of January, 2025
  • CAT exam fees: IIM Calcutta has increased the CAT exam fee by Rs 100 for general and Rs 50 for reserved category candidates. As per the notice, the CAT form fee is Rs 2500 for general and Rs 1250 for reserved category candidates.
  • CAT exam cities: This year, the CAT exam centres have increased from 167 to 170. Candidates can choose only five options while filling out the CAT exam form.
  • CAT exam 2024 conducting body: IIM Calcutta will conduct the CAT exam 2024 this year.
  • CAT Preparation in Advance: Since CAT is a competitive exam, it is recommended to prepare well in advance. Use this time to familiarize yourself with the exam format, syllabus, and question types. You can find various study materials, mock tests, and training options online and through institutions.

CAT Exam Resource for Preparation

  • Best Books for CAT Quantitative Aptitude
  • Best Books for CAT VARC

CAT Exam 2024 - Overview

Remember that CAT exam is a very challenging test so it is important to prepare well in advance. If you want to take the CAT exam in 2024, it is better to start your CAT preparation at least nine months in advance.

The CAT exam 2024 registration started on August 1, 2024, in online mode at iimcat.ac.in. Eligible and interested candidates fill out the online CAT exam form and pay the fee by September 20, 2024. Candidates who want to appear in the CAT exam 2024 must know about the CAT eligibility criteria, CAT exam syllabus, CAT exam pattern, and the time required to complete the entire syllabus to crack the CAT exam and get admission in the top IIMs.

Last year, 3.28 lakh candidates registered for the CAT exam, out of which 2.88 lakh candidates wrote the CAT entrance exam. This year, it is expected that more than 3.5 lakh candidates will register for the CAT exam. Read all about CAT 2024.

What is CAT Exam?

Most of the aspirants have a question, i.e., the CAT exam is for what purpose? The answer to the question is that the Common Admission Test (CAT) is a national-level MBA entrance exam conducted by IIMs on a rotational basis every year. The IIM CAT exam is considered one of the toughest MBA entrance exams to crack for MBA, PGDM, Executive MBA, PhD, and FPM admission to top B-schools and over 1,200 colleges in India. IIMs are one of the top MBA colleges in India, offering MBA and PGDM programmes through the CAT exam and scoring between 82 and 99+ percentiles. Other top MBA colleges in India accepting CAT are IITs, SPJIMR, FMS Delhi, MDI, IIFT, etc. Check out more CAT entrance exam details given below.

Full Form of CAT

CAT full form is Common Admission Test. It is a national-level entrance exam conducted for admission to Master of Management (MBA) programs at top Indian B-schools, particularly the Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs). The Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) conducts a national-level MBA exam in CBT mode called the Common Admission Test for PGDM/MBA admissions to various B-schools in India. 

  • The CAT exam is conducted in three sessions on a single day at around 400 exam centres in 155 cities across India.
  • What are the 3 subjects of CAT exam for MBA? The CAT exam 2024 syllabus consists of three sections: Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning (DILR), Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension (VARC), and Quantitative Ability (QA). 
  • The CAT exam pattern consists of 66 questions to be solved within 120 minutes. Questions asked in CAT exam are a mix of MCQs and non-MCQs. 
  • Cracking CAT is perceived as difficult by many on account of the high cutoff scores needed for MBA admissions. CAT is designed to test candidates on their analytical and reasoning abilities. 
  • More than two lakh candidates apply for the CAT exam every year. In last year's CAT exam, registration set a new record with 3.30 lakh applications.
  • CAT Exam Purpose: Know here that the CAT exam is for what purpose?

Things to Know about CAT Exam 2024

  • CAT Exam Eligibility: According to the CAT exam eligibility, Candidates who completed a bachelor's degree with 50% (45% for SC/ST/PwD) are eligible to apply for CAT exam 2024.
  • CAT Exam Syllabus: The CAT exam syllabus includes VARC, DILR, and QA. The main topics to cover in CAT 2024 exam syllabus are Algebra, Geometry, Percentage, Arithmetic, Graphs, Series Completion, Coding-Decoding, etc.
  • How much does a CAT exam cost?: The CAT exam fee for SC/ST/PwD candidates is Rs 1250 and Rs 2500 for all other candidates.

All the CAT latest updates and CAT exam notifications are regularly published here and on the official iimcat.ac.in website for candidates planning to appear for CAT 2024.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To appear in the CAT exam 2024, one must meet the CAT 2024 eligibility criteria specified by the IIMs. This includes meeting the specified criteria of academics, passing the qualifying exam, and meeting the age limit. So, what is CAT exam eligibility? The details are below:

Eligibility Criteria for CAT exam 2024

  • Qualifying exam and pass percentage: To appear in the CAT exam 2024, a bachelor's degree with a CGPA of at least 50% (aggregate 45% for SC, ST, and PwD/DA categories) from a recognized university is a must.
  • Degree duration and mode: It must be a 3-year programme. The mode can be regular, distance, or online.
  • Final year students: Anyone in their final year or awaiting their degree results can apply for the CAT exam 2024.
  • Professional degree: Candidates with a professional degree (CA/ CS/ ICWA/ FCAI) are also eligible.
  • Working experience: The CAT entrance exam is open to both fresh graduates and working professionals. However, work experience is an advantage during admissions after the CAT exam.

CAT Exam Age Limit

There is no age limit for appearing in the CAT exam. If you want to take the CAT exam, you can take it anytime throughout your life. Although there is no minimum or maximum age limit for appearing in the CAT exam, we tell you that a candidate must be a graduate to appear in this CAT 2024 exam.

NOTE: This is just the CAT exam eligibility. However, eligibility for admissions will differ and involve various parameters.

application_process.html_content:
IIM Calcutta commenced the registration window for the CAT exam on August 1, 2024. Candidates could register at iimcat.ac.in to appear for the CAT exam 2024 till September 20, 2024.

Is the correction window for the CAT exam opened?

IIM Calcutta will open the correction window for CAT 2024 after the registrations close. The dates to correct the mistake in the CAT application form tentatively are September 26 to 29. Mistakes in details and scanned images (signature or photograph) are some inputs that may be allowed for correction.

How to register for CAT Exam?

  • Visit iimcat.ac.in, the official IIM CAT website.
  • Click on the 'New registration' link.
  • Enter your name, date of birth, nationality, phone number, and email ID and register for the CAT entrance exam.
  • Use ID received in the email to fill out the application form for CAT 2024.
  • Next, enter your personal and academic details.
  • Upload a recent passport-size photo and signature in the prescribed format and size.
  • Choose the preferred MBA/PGDM courses and IIMs in the order of preference.
  • Then, select 5 CAT test cities as per preference. Check the list of CAT test cities before submitting.

  • Finally, pay the CAT exam fees via credit or debit card or net banking.

All the latest CAT exam news and live updates will be available on the CAT 2024 website.

Documents required for CAT Exam Application

  • Personal details, including a valid email, category
  • Academic details from class 10 onwards with marks, percentage and year of passing
  • Clear photograph with a white background, not more than 6 months old (1200 pixels x 1200 pixels) in a .jpg or .jpeg file of a size not more than 80KB. 
  • Scanned signature with dimensions of 80mm X 35mm in a .jpg or .jpeg file of a size not more than 80KB.
  • Academic certificates
  • PwD certificate as applicable (if any)
  • EWS/Category Certificate as applicable (if any)
  • Identification document

How much is CAT exam fee?

  • SC, ST and PwD category candidates have to pay Rs 1250

preparation_tips.html_content:
Preparation for the CAT exam should start nine months before the CAT 2024 exam date. CAT exam preparation includes completing the CAT syllabus phase-wise, mock test practice, and revision. Candidates can join a coaching institute for the CAT exam or study on their own with the help of online study groups, books, and resources. Check the table below for important articles about CAT exam preparation.

CAT 2024 Exam Preparation from May to November 2024

May is the month when every CAT exam aspirant gets serious about their preparation. If you haven't started your CAT exam preparation yet, May is the best time to start your preparation. We have created a detailed map of your CAT exam 2024 preparation from May to November.

CAT Exam Preparation Months 

CAT Exam Preparation Pointers 

CAT Exam Mocks

May to June

  • Focus on building your basics for all three sections in CAT

  • Dedicate these two months to understanding the fundamentals in Quants and LRDI section

  • Try to do level 1 and level 2 questions  from each chapter

  • For CAT VARC, try increasing your reading speed and improving your critical reasoning. You can practice critical reasoning questions from CAT official guide or any coaching material

  • You can start by giving lots of sectional tests. 
  • Give at least 2 sections each week

July to August 

  • In these two months, solve advanced-level CAT questions

  • Solve all the CAT exam previous year's questions

  • Focus on improving your speed while solving DILR sets and reading comprehension  

Give sectionals as well as mocks 

September to November

  • These months would be solely dedicated to solving CAT exam mocks and revisions 

  • Give lots of mocks and analyse them carefully 

  • These months should be dedicated to preparing you for any type of question that comes up in the CAT exam.

Give at least 20 mocks in these months 



Can CAT be cleared in 6 months?

Usually, students search for whether they can ace the CAT entrance test with six months of preparation, so the answer is yes, it is quite possible and feasible. Candidates need to believe in themselves and stay committed to their goals.

6 Months Roadmap to CAT 2024: Tips and Tricks for 99%tile

Question: What CAT score is required for IIM?

Answer: The CAT score for IIMs varies depending on the IIM campus. The highest CAT cutoff for major IIMs like IIM Ahmedabad, IIM Bangalore, IIM Calcutta, IIM Lucknow, IIM Kozhikode, etc., is 94 to 99+ and the minimum is 80. faqs.question: What is the pass mark for CAT exam?
faqs.answer: There are no designated pass marks. In fact, CAT exam scores are in the form of percentiles, which are used by various BSchools including IIMs, for admission purposes.

faqs.question: Can I switch between questions in CAT?
faqs.answer: Although switching between sections is not allowed in the CAT exam, switching between questions within a section can reduce your chances of scoring. By dividing each section of the CAT exam into three rounds, the process can be made more streamlined.

faqs.question: Is IIM CAT exam tough?
faqs.answer: This is always dependent on the preparation, but in general, the CAT exam is not very tough. There is a lot of competition, but with a good amount of dedication and preparation, its easy to crack the CAT exam.

faqs.question: Is CAT compulsory for MBA?
faqs.answer: No, CAT is not compulsory for MBA. But the 21 IIMs and 1000+ B-schools in India offer MBA admissions based on the CAT exam, which is one of the toughest exams in India with high competition. This is the reason many management aspirants apply for the CAT exam 2024.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for CAT exam?
faqs.answer: Candidates having a bachelor's degree and a minimum of 50% marks (45% in the case of SC, ST, and PwD) are eligible to appear for the CAT exam 2024.

faqs.question: Do CAT questions get repeated?
faqs.answer: IIM develops new and innovative questions every year to assess candidates' problem-solving skills, logical reasoning, and aptitude. Questions may not be exactly repeated in the CAT exam, and similar concepts or patterns may be found in different years.

faqs.question: Is CAT done after 12th?
faqs.answer: No, 12th-grade student is not eligible for CAT. Since CAT is an MBA entrance exam, a candidate must have a Bachelor's degree.

faqs.question: Is the CAT exam only for MBA?
faqs.answer: In short, while CAT is an essential test for MBA aspirants targeting top B-schools in India, it is not a mandatory requirement for all MBA programmes.

faqs.question: Is CAT for Engineering?
faqs.answer: CAT is not only for engineering students. Traditionally, engineering students write CAT in large numbers. Also, CAT's exam pattern, which includes VARC, QA, and DILR, is designed to test candidates' problem-solving skills.

exam_name: SPJAT - S P Jain Aptitude Test
conducting_body: SP Jain School of Global Management

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
SPJAT or S P Jain Aptitude Test is a management entrance test conducted by S P Jain School of Global Management for admission to its management programmes. The exam is conducted four times a year usually in the month of April, May, June, and July. It’s an online test of a 1-hour duration carrying around 46 questions. The SPJAT 2024 exam covers topics such as General Awareness, Logical and Reasoning Ability, Mathematics, Current Affairs, Business Awareness, etc. The test takers are shortlisted on the basis of their SPJAT 2024 score for the selection rounds which includes panel interview and essay writing. 

The registration for the SP JAT 2024 is now available. Candidates can register for SPJAT 2024 in online mode at spjain.org. Candidates must have a graduation degree in order to apply. Those who are pursuing their final year of graduation are also eligible to appear for the SPJAT entrance test. The institute also accepts CAT or GMAT scores for the admission process.

highlights.value: SP Jain School of Global Management

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Before applying for the SPJAT exam, the candidate must check the eligibility criteria for SPJAT 2024. As per the eligibility criteria, you should have a graduation degree in any discipline from a recognized university. You can apply for SPJAT 2024 if you are in the final year of your graduation and the result is awaited. 

A full-time work experience of 0-3 years is also considered under the SPJAT eligibility criteria.

If the medium of education in school was not English, you need to have an English Language Proficiency Score (ELPS) at the time of taking admission. However, you can apply for the exam.

application_process.html_content:
The application process for SPJAT 2024 is completely online. You can register for the exam online on the official website of the institute. First, you fill out and submit the application form for the SPJAT 2024 programme. Once you submit your application, it will show the status ‘Screening in Progress’. 

If you have already appeared for the CAT, GMAT, or SPJAT exam, your application will be evaluated to get shortlisted for the selection rounds. 

If you haven’t appeared for the mentioned exams already, the status will be shown as ‘Shortlisted for Aptitude Test’. After that, you can log in to the portal to register for the SPJAT 2024 exam by paying the application fee, i.e., USD 40.

admit_card.html_content: The institute will send the admit card of SPJAT 2024 to the candidates who register for the exam by paying the application fee. The candidates will also receive the login details for the online test along with the SPJAT 2024 admit card. The e-mail will also include the test instructions. Candidates are advised to keep the admit card until the selection process gets over. The document will be required at this stage.

cutoffs.html_content: The institute has prescribed the SPJAT cutoff. Candidates need to score 80 percentile or above in the SPJAT 2024 exam to qualify. After that, candidates will be shortlisted for the selection or evaluation process. The shortlisted candidates will appear for essay writing rounds, analyzing case studies, and panel interviews. The cutoff of SPJAT 2024 is the minimum mark that a candidate need to score in order to qualify for the test.
