  • Go through the UPESMET - UG exam pattern to develop a robust strategy for taking the exam. 
  • Look for the best books to prepare for all four sections.
  • Solve previous year question papers and mock tests keeping in mind the time duration of the exam.
  • You must be familiar with the use of a computer so that there are no last-minute surprises for you. 
  • Keep an eye on the ongoing national and international news to perform well in the General Awareness section. 
  • It is advisable to cover the news around awards, sports, literature, history, economics etc., for at least the past year.
  • Develop a reading habit and be consistent. You can read magazines, books, and editorials; it will help you perform well in the General English section. 
  • During the last few days, it is advisable to focus on revision rather than concentrating on learning anything new.

exam_name: HPU MAT - HP University Management Aptitude Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
HPU MAT exam 2024: Himachal Pradesh University Management Aptitude Test or HPU MAT is the management entrance test conducted by the Business School of Himachal Pradesh University for admission to its MBA programme. The authority released the HPU MAT exam result on the official website- hpuniv.ac.in on June 24, 2024. HPU MAT 2024 cutoff has been released by authorities in online mode on June 29. The authorities will conduct the GD/ PI rounds for subsidized seats from July 8 to 11, 2024 and for non-subsidized seats, it will be from July 15 to 20, 2024.

The HPU MAT 2024 was conducted on June 6, 2024. Around 3,000 candidates appear for the offline exam (paper-pencil) every year. The HP University, Shimla offers around 50 (15 Subsidized + 35 Non-Subsidized) seats through this test.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
• The eligibility criteria of HPU MAT 2024 state that General category candidates with a minimum of 50 percent marks in Graduation in any stream from a recognized university can apply for the exam. 
  • The HPU MAT 2024 eligibility criteria are a little different for reserved categories (SC/ ST). The candidate who belongs to the mentioned categories with a minimum of 45 percent marks in Graduation is eligible for the exam. 
  • The exam has an age limit of 26 years for boys and 28 years for girls. The maximum age for SC/ ST category girls is 29 years.
  • The age limit is not applicable for non-subsidized students, defense personnel, and nominee of the State/ Central Government of India. Candidates are advised to check the HPU MAT eligibility criteria before applying for the exam.

application_process.html_content:
As per the HPU MAT exam notification, the window for the application form for HPU MAT 2024 has been closed in online mode on May 25, 2024. 

To fill out the HPU MAT 2024 application form, candidates are required to have a scanned copy of their passport size photograph & signature, a scanned copy of the candidate’s parent’s signature, passing certificate(s) and mark sheet (s), and a valid mobile number & email address. 

The application fee for the General and Reserved categories is Rs. 1000 and Rs. 500 respectively. The fee can be paid via net banking, credit/debit card, and bank challan.

admit_card.html_content:
HPU Business School was issued the admit card for the HPU MAT 2024 exam in online mode last week of May. To download the HPU MAT 2024 admit card, candidates have to visit the official website and log in with their HPU MAT registration id and password. 

To appear for the exam, candidates must carry the HPU MAT admit card 2024 to the exam centre. No candidate will be allowed to appear for the exam without the admit card. Keep a copy of the admit card until the completion of the admission process as it’s required at every stage.

cutoffs.html_content:
The HPU MAT cutoff 2024 will be released after the declaration of the result. It’s the minimum mark that a candidate needs to score in order to get shortlisted for the admission process. HPU Business releases the cutoff for all categories including General, SC, ST, and Subsidised & Non-Subsidised seats. 

The candidates who meet the HPU MAT 2024 cutoff criterion enter the selection process that includes GD and PI. Overall performance in the exam and the selection rounds leads to final admission. 

The cutoff of HPU MAT 2024 depends on various factors such as the total number of candidates appearing for the exam, the number of candidates qualifying for the entrance exam, the difficulty level of the question paper, and the total number of seats available.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The HPU MAT 2024 entrance exam was held on June 6. As per the HPU MAT 2024 exam pattern, the exam will be an offline test (paper-pencil medium). 

The duration of the exam is two hours and is composed of 200 multiple-choice questions divided into four sections - English Comprehension & Language, General Intelligence & Critical Reasoning, General Knowledge & Business Awareness, and Numerical Ability & Data Interpretation. 

Each section has around 50 questions and each question carries 1 mark. The exam doesn’t have negative markings. Candidates are advised to attempt all the questions. The exam is conducted at multiple centres across Himachal Pradesh including Mandi, Palampur, Shimla, Chandigarh, Dharamshala, etc. 

Candidates are advised to prepare according to the HPU MAT exam pattern 2024. It'll allow them strategies their preparation.

exam_name: NBSAT - Narayana Business School Admission Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Narayana Business School has started NBSAT 2025 registrations in online mode. Interested and eligible candidates can register for NBSAT 2025 entrance test till November 26, 2024 (Phase 1). NBSAT entrance test will be conducted in online mode. The total time duration for NBSAT 2025 entrance test will be 120 minutes (2 hours). Narayana Business School Admission Test (NBSAT) will be conducted by Narayana Business School (NBS) for admission to its MBA/ PGDM programs. NBSAT 2025 (Phase 1) will be held on December 1, 2024 and Phase 2 will be held on February 2, 2025. 

NBSAT Paper Pattern

The NBSAT questions paper will comprise questions from Quantitative Techniques (QT), Vocabulary & Analytical Reasoning (AR) and Reading Comprehension (RC), and Data Interpretation & Data Adequacy (DI & DA).

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To appear for NBSAT 2025, candidates must be eligible and meet the Narayana Business School (NBS) defined eligibility criteria for the exam. Candidates must note that the eligibility criteria for the NBSAT exam and MBA admissions will differ. Check out the detailed NBSAT eligibility criteria 2025.

  • Candidates should have completed their graduation from any recognized University/ Institution of National Importance and must have secured a minimum of 50% marks or equivalent grade (45% marks or equivalent grade for Scheduled castes/ Scheduled tribes) candidates at graduation.
  • Candidates appearing for the final year of graduation or equivalent qualification and are awaiting results are also eligible for NBSAT 2025.
  • Candidates must have studied Mathematics/ Statistics at class 12th level. A graduation degree in Computer Applications, IT engineering, or Statistics would be an added advantage for the PGDM-DS-A program.
  • Candidates must have studied Mathematics/ Statistics at class 12th level. A graduation degree in statistics, finance, or economics would be an added advantage for the PGDM-QF program.
  • Work experience- There is no minimum or maximum work experience required to apply for NBS MBA/ PGDM program. However, having work experience will be an add-on advantage that irradiates the admission chances.

application_process.html_content:
Narayana Business School (NBS) commenced NBSAT registrations 2025 in online mode on the official website- admission.nbs.edu.in. The NBSAT 2025 application deadline is November 26, 2024 (Phase 1). Know how to fill the application for the NBSAT exam below.

NBSAT application form 2025- Important instructions

  • NBSAT application fee is non-refundable.
  • Email ID submitted at the time of NBSAT registration will be used for all correspondence until NBSAT enrolment is completed. Change in Email address will not be permitted under any circumstances.

How to fill NBSAT application form 2025?

NBSAT application form is available in online mode on the official website. Candidates can refer to the following steps to fill NBSAT online application form.

Steps to fill NBSAT application form

Step 1- Visit the official website of NBSAT- admission.nbs.edu.in
Step 2- Click on the “Apply Now” tab and enter the name, email ID, mobile number, password, state, city, and course
Step 3- Now click on the “I agree” check box and register for the exam
Step 4- Fill the NBSAT 2025 application form with academic details
Step 5- Upload required documents (scanned photograph and signature) in prescribed dimensions
Step 6- Pay the NBSAT application fee of Rs 1,000 by using debit/ credit card or net banking
Step 7- Review all the entered details in NBSAT application form and submit it

admit_card.html_content:
Narayana Business School (NBS) will issue the NBSAT admit card 2025 to those candidates who complete the application process. NBSAT 2025 admit card will be available in online mode only on the official website. Candidates will be able to download the NBSAT admit card prior to the entrance test. 

NBSAT admit card is an important document that must be carried on the day of examination. Before starting the NBSAT entrance test, candidates will have to show the admit card of NBSAT to the proctored. Along with NBSAT admit card 2025 candidates will also have to show a valid original ID proof. NBSAT admit card contains details like the name of the candidate, photograph, exam date, and exam day instructions.

NBSAT important guidelines 2025

  • The candidates are required to report online by 10:45 AM to undergo, user ID, password, and photo ID proof verification
  • The duration of the test is 120 minutes (11:00 AM to 1:00 PM)
  • After 11:00 AM, no candidates will be allowed to appear for the NBSAT 2025
  • The NBSAT 2025 test will automatically close at 1:00 PM. No extra time will be allotted under any circumstances
  • If a candidate is found using any unfair means will forfeit his/her chances of being considered for admission and also debarred from receiving NBSAT scorecard
  • The scores published by NBS will be final and will not be subject to any appeal or revaluation

exam_name: SMAT - Shiv Nadar University Management Aptitude Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Shiv Nadar University will conduct the Shiv Nadar University Management Admission Test or SMAT 2024 for admission to its MBA programmes, for the applicants who have registered on or before the last date. The test will be a pen and paper-based one for 90 minutes with questions asked on Quantitative Aptitude, Data Interpretation, Logical Reasoning, and Verbal Reading Comprehension. Each component will have 20 questions. 

It is to be noted that candidates who score above the 65 percentile in CAT/ NMAT/ XAT/ GMAT or above 80 percentile in CMAT are exempt from appearing for SMAT. Shortlisted candidates will also have to appear for a comprehensive personal evaluation process the dates of which will be intimated by the university, Shortlisting is based on the scores in SMAT 2024 OR valid scores in CAT/ NMAT/ XAT/ CMAT/ GMAT. The final selection will be based on the performance in the personal evaluation and scores of the entrance exam.

Candidates may note that CAT 2022, 23/ NMAT 2022, 23/ XAT 2023, 24/ CMAT 2023, 24/ Valid GMAT (2020 onwards) scores are only accepted for ongoing admissions.

highlights.value: Shiv Nadar University Management Aptitude Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Before filling out the SMAT application form, candidates must check the SMAT 2024 eligibility criteria in order to avoid cancellation or inconvenience during the admission process. Candidates must fulfill the following eligibility criteria of SMAT 2024 which is specified by Shiv Nadar University :

  • Candidates must hold a Bachelor's Degree or equivalent, from any of the recognized Universities, Deemed Universities, Institutions of National Importance, or from a Professional Body including ICAI, ICSI, ICWAI, etc. Additionally, they must have scored a minimum of 50 percent marks or equivalent CGPA in their graduation.
  • Candidates appearing for their final year exams of graduation or post-graduation are also eligible to apply for the programme. They will have to produce a certificate by November 30, 2024, from the Principal/Registrar of their college/ institute stating that they have completed all the requisites for obtaining the bachelor's degree/ equivalent. The transcript or mark sheet of the final examination should be submitted at the Registrar's office latest by October 31, 2024.

  • Besides the academic qualifications, candidates must also have scored above 65 percentile in any of the following qualifying examinations-

(i) CAT 2022/ 2023
(ii) GMAT (2020 onwards)
(iii) NMAT 2022/ 2023
(iv) XAT 2023/ 2024
(v) CMAT 2023/ 2024 (Candidates must have scored above 80 percentile)
OR
(vi) valid scores in SMAT (Shiv Nadar University Management Aptitude Test)*

*Candidates who have valid scores in CAT/GMAT/XAT/NMAT/CMAT as mentioned above are exempt from appearing for SMAT 2024.

application_process.html_content:
In order to apply for Shiv Nadar University for MBA admission 2024, applicants first need to register on the official website of Shiv Nadar University. After registration, the application form of SMAT 2024 is available for download. Candidates can also choose to not take the SMAT test but apply through scores of any of the following exams:

(i) CAT 2022/ 2023
(ii) GMAT (2020 onwards)
(iii) NMAT 2022/ 2023
(iv) XAT 2023/ 2024
(v) CMAT 2023/ 2024

Steps to fill SMAT 2024 application form

  • Visit the official website of Shiv Nadar University and register with the help of a valid email ID and password
  • After registering for SMAT, a unique ID number will be generated through which candidates can access the application form of SMAT 2024
  • Fill in the SMAT application form 2024 and verify that all the information entered is correct before clicking on the final ‘Submit’ button
  • Pay the application fee of Rs. 1200 through any of the payment modes available like-

  1. Net banking

  2. Debit/credit card

  3. A Demand draft - In favour of Shiv Nadar University payable at Noida. The DD must be sent to the following address along with a hard copy of the filled up application form of SMAT 2024.

Shiv Nadar University
Admission Office
NH91, Tehsil Dadri
Gautam Budh Nagar
Uttar Pradesh-201314

  • It is ideal for the candidates to preserve a copy of the filled SMAT application form 2024 along with payment receipt until the end of the admission process.

100% Application Fee Waiver

Candidates who are holding Bachelor's degree or equivalent from a recognized university, with a minimum of 50% marks in aggregate will be given 100% application fee waiver based on the score obtained in any of the following entrance examinations:

  • CAT- 60 percentile or above
  • XAT- 60 percentile or above
  • CMAT- 80 percentile or above
  • NMAT- Score 180 or above
  • GMAT- Score 550 or above

1. Quantitative Aptitude

Each of the three sections carries objective-type questions. As per the marking scheme, each section carries 40 marks making it a total of 120 marks. exam_name: GMET - Guru Nanak Dev University Management Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
GMET 2025 is conducted by Guru Nanak Dev University (GNDU), Amritsar for two-year MBA admission. The various management courses offered at GNDU in MBA include General, Financial Services, and Marketing and Retail Management. GMET 2025 is to be conducted by GNDU’s University Business School. As per the eligibility criteria to appear for GMET 2025, candidates must have a Bachelor’s degree and have secured at least 50 per cent aggregate marks in the same. Meanwhile, the candidates with 45% from SC/ST categories can apply for the GMET exam.

GMET will be held in computer-based mode for a duration of two and half hours and consist of objective-type questions only. GMET 2025 will evaluate candidates based on four sections, namely- Mental and Numerical Ability, General Knowledge, General English, and Business Aptitude. Candidates who clear the GMET cutoff will be invited for counselling for admission to the desired college under GNDU.

highlights.value: Guru Nanak Dev University Management Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Before filling out the GMET application form, candidates must check the GMET 2025 eligibility criteria to avoid cancellation or inconvenience during the MBA admission process. Guru Nanak Dev University (GNDU) prescribes the GMET eligibility criteria. Candidates who do not satisfy norms will not be considered for admission to GNDU. Check the GMET 2025 eligibility criteria below:

  • Candidate should have a Bachelor's degree or an equivalent qualification in any discipline from a recognised university. Additionally, General category candidates must have secured a minimum of 50 per cent marks and Reserved (SC/ST) category candidates must have secured at least 45 per cent marks in the same.

  • Candidates in their final year of graduation can also apply for GMET 2025 conducted by GNDU.

application_process.html_content:
GMET 2025 application form will be released by Guru Nanak Dev University online mode at online.gndu.ac.in and interested candidates can complete the GNDU GMET application form before the deadline. An application fee must also be paid at the time of submitting GMET 2025 application forms.

How to fill GMET application form 2025:

  • Visit the official website of Guru Nanak Dev University.
  • Click on the 'Admission' tab and select 'MBA’ programme from the menu.
  • Click on ‘Register’, enter Name, Date of Birth, Father’s Name, Category, Password, Security key and other details asked to generate Fee Deposit Slip bearing a unique Reference number.
  • Next, take a print out of Fee Deposit Slip.
  • Submit the slip to the nearest State Bank of India branch along with the application fee for GMET 2025. The GMET exam registration fee is Rs 1200 for General category and Rs. 600 for SC/ST students. 
  • Upon submitting, the bank will issue a Journal ID in the name of the candidate.
  • Go back to filling the application form-three days after receiving Journal ID.
  • Enter the Journal ID given by the bank and fill all the details carefully. 
  • Ensure that the details are correct because no editing will be allowed later. 
  • After filling all the fields in the application form, click on the ‘SUBMIT’ tab, and view the details filled for one last time. Make any corrections if necessary.
  • Click on the ‘LOCK’ tab. The submitted application form of GMET 2025 will appear with a unique ID. 
  • Take a print-out of GMET 2025 application form. Candidates will be required to carry this application form at the time of the counselling process.

admit_card.html_content:
The admit card for GMET 2025 is expected to be released by GNDU one week before the exam. GMET 2025 hall ticket will be available in online mode only and must be downloaded from the website of GNDU. No hard copies of the admit card will be sent.

How to download GMET 2025 admit card:

  • Visit Guru Nanak Dev University website
  • Go to admissions section and click GMET tab
  • Enter the login credentials given at the time of GMET 2025 registration.
  • Download admit card of GMET.

The hall ticket will mention the following details:

  • Name of the Candidate
  • Roll Number
  • Name of Exam/stream
  • Exam date, time and venue

  • Candidate’s photograph and contact details

Any error or discrepancy in the admit card must immediately be reported to the conducting authority for rectification. The admit card of GMET 2025 is a mandatory document which should be carried to the exam hall on test day. Without this, candidates will be barred from taking the exam.

It is advised that candidates carry a valid Photo ID with them, besides the admit card of GMET issued by GNDU. The ID may be any one of the following:

  • Passport
  • Voter ID card
  • PAN card
  • Aadhaar card

counselling_process.html_content:

It is important to note that Guru Nanak Dev University shall conduct two rounds of GMET counselling for admission to MBA programme. Selected candidates must come in person to the respective counselling venue on the said date. 

Documents to be carried on the day of GMET 2025 counselling:

  • Original certificates and mark sheets of class 10, 12 and graduation
  • Recent passport-size photos
  • Category certificates (eg. SC/ST etc, if applicable)

faqs.answer: The exam centres of GMET are Amritsar and Jalandhar.

exam_name: XAT - Xavier Aptitude Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
XLRI Jamshedpur has increased the number of XAT 2025 exam centers. Authorities will close XAT exam registration window on November 3. Candidates can apply for XAT exam 2025 in online mode at xatonline.in. XAT exam is scheduled to be held on January 5. The XAT exam will be a computer-based test for MBA and PGDM admissions in XLRI and 10 other XAMI, 600+ MBA colleges across India. XLRI Jamshedpur will conduct the XAT 2025 in 109 test cities. The mock test for XAT 2025 entrance exam will be conducted on September 25.  Last year, 1.35 lakh candidates applied for the XAT entrance exam. Candidates are advised to complete the registration process before last date to apply for XAT exam.

Changes made in XAT exam 2025

XLRI announced changes in XAT 2025 exam pattern. This year the XAT exam will be held for 180 minutes only. Essay writing section has been removed from XAT paper. Along with remove of Essay writing, the number of questions in the general knowledge section has also been reduced. Also, performance in GK will be evaluated during the XLRI selection process. According to the revised XAT exam pattern, the question paper will have total of 95 questions.

XAT Exam 2025

Xavier Aptitude Test (XAT exam) is conducted by XLRI Jamshedpur to offer admission into MBA/PGDM program for admission at XLRI and other top MBA colleges. XAT exam scorecard is accepted by many top B-schools such as SPJIMR Mumbai, IMT Ghaziabad, XIMB Bhubaneswar, and 150+ other top Indian MBA colleges. XAT score is not accepted by IIMs. IIT's also does not accept XAT scorecard for MBA admission.  XAT score card is accepted by XLRI and it's other associated colleges. 

Those candidates who have completed their Bachelor's degree in any discipline from a recognized university are eligible to apply for the XAT exam. The XAT exam is considered more challenging as compared to CAT because the XAT exam has a more varied paper pattern than CAT. XAT exam scorecard is not accepted by IIMs and XLRI conduct XAT exam once a year. 

Candidates who are looking for admission to top MBA colleges like XIM University, IMT Ghaziabad, FORE New Delhi, TAPMI Manipal, K J Somaiya Mumbai, have to appear for the XAT exam 2025. The XAT exam cutoff usually ranges between 95 to 96 percentile. For female candidates, the cutoff for the XAT exam is lower by 4 to 5 percentiles.

Check out how to calculate the XAT percentile and score

XAT Exam 2025: Latest Updates

Check out the upcoming and latest events on the XAT exam 2025 for MBA/PGDM admission in XLRI and 10 other XAMI, 600+ BSchools in India.

  • XLRI Jamshedpur has revised the XAT 2025 exam pattern.
  • The XAT 2025 question paper will have 95 questions.
  • XAT 2024 application form is available in online mode on the official website- xatonline.in.
  • XLRI Jamshedpur seats for PGDM (BM) increased to 240 from 180.
  • XLRI Delhi NCR campus seats for PGDM (BM) increased to 180 from 120.

What is XAT Exam?

Xavier Aptitude Test (XAT) is a national-level management entrance examination conducted by XLRI Jamshedpur. The XAT exam assesses candidates' potential for future business success. The XAT 2025 is taken for MBA/ PGDM admissions offered by some of the most prestigious institutes in the nation. Apart from XLRI and 10 other XAMI members, over 1000 B-schools accept XAT scores for admission to their post-graduate management programmes.

Candidates who hold a three-year bachelor's degree or equivalent in any discipline are eligible to apply for the XAT exam 2025. Final-year candidates are also eligible to appear for this XLRI XAT exam. There is no upper age limit as per the XAT exam eligibility.

Is XAT tougher than CAT?

Xavier Aptitude Test (XAT) is considered more challenging than the Common Admission Test (CAT) because of certain aspects such as. Exam Pattern: The XAT exam has a more varied paper pattern as compared to the CAT exam. XAT exam pattern has an additional section such as General Knowledge (GK), Essay Writing, and Decision-making that require a different skill set as compared to CAT exam. 

Question- How many times XAT is held in a year?

Answer- The Xavier Aptitude Test (XAT exam) is held once a year in CBT mode and there is no limitation to appearing for the XAT. Candidates can appear as many times as they wish. 

Question- What is the XAT selection criteria for XLRI admission?

Answer- XAT selection process for XLRI admission includes the shortlisting of candidates on the basis of XAT or GMAT score, Personal Interview (PI) and Group Discussion (GD). However, the final admission will be granted on the basis of XAT exam score, personal interview, group discussion, past academic qualification, and gender diversity. Also, before appearing for XAT selection process, candidates must meet the required cut-off criteria. 

Who is eligible for XAT 2025?

XLRI Jamshedpur has set eligibility criteria for such candidates who want to take the XAT exam. Here we have listed all the parameters related to XAT exam eligibility criteria 2025.

  • Graduation: It is mandatory to have a bachelor's degree or its equivalent in any discipline from a recognized university or institution.
  • Age bar: There are no upper age limit criteria to appear for XAT exam.
  • Minimum Marks: There are no minimum aggregate bachelor's marks criteria to apply for the XAT exam.
  • Final year student: Those who are pursuing their final year of graduation are also eligible to apply for XAT entrance test.
  • Number of XAT exam attempts:  There is no limit on the number of times a candidate to take the XAT exam.

XAT exam registration and fees

Every year more than 1 lakh candidates register for the XAT exam. The registration process for XAT exam is completely online and the XAT exam online form will be available on the official website- xatonlin.in. 

XAT exam fees

ParticularsApplication fee
Registration feeRs 2200 (+200 for candidates interested in XLRI programs)
Indian candidates applying for GMP program through GMATRs 2500
NRI/ Foreign candidates applying for one or more program through GMATRs 5000

Question- What is the XAT exam used for?

Answer- Xavier Aptitude Test (XAT) is a management admission test conducted for admission to MBA/ PGDM program in XLRI Jamshedpur and other top MBA colleges like IMT Ghaziabad, XIMB, LBSIM Delhi, IMIM New Delhi, TAPMI Manipal and other top MBA colleges in India accepting XAT score. 

XAT Exam Syllabus- Overview and Important Topics

Decision Making (DM)21 questions from Critical thinking, problem-solving skills, Informed decision making
Verbal Ability and Logical Reasoning (VA & LR)26 questions from Critical & analytical reasoning, reading comprehensions (including poems & passages), vocabulary, English grammar
Quantitative Aptitude and Data Interpretation (QA & DI)28 questions from Quantitative aptitude, arithmetic, algebra, geometry, mensuration, modern maths
General Knowledge* (GK)8 questions from static GK and 12 questions from current affairs
Analytical Essay Writing* (AEW)One Essay of 250 words. 3 topics will be given. Candidates need to pick 1.

People also ask about the XAT exam 2025

Question- Is XAT difficult than CAT?

Answer- Both the XAT and CAT exams are difficult but many students find the XAT more difficult as compared to the CAT entrance test because of two sections in the XAT exam paper- Decision-Making and Verbal section. The Verbal section of the XAT exam consists of passages longer than that of the CAT exam.

Question- Who is eligible for the XAT exam?

Answer- Those candidates who have completed their three years of bachelor's degree from a recognized university or institute or those who are in the final year of graduation are also eligible to apply for the XAT exam.

Question- Does XAT have negative marking?

Answer- Yes, for every incorrect answer 0.25 marks will be deducted and 0.10 marks will be deducted for unattempted question after leaving 8 questions unanswered.

Download XAT previous year question paper

While preparing for the XAT exam, it is a must for candidates to solve the previous year's XAT exam papers to ace this national-level MBA entrance exam with decent percentile.

Question- Is 25 a good score in XAT?

Answer- Going by past year's XAT score vs percentile, scoring 25 marks in XAT would be close to 85 percentile in XAT entrance test.

Question- Which Section syllabus in XAT is considered more difficult to cover?

Answer- Decision Making (DM) section is considered quite difficult to cover for XAT exam. However, it depends on candidates aptitude skills. If a candidate have Mathematics as their background, they may find Quant and DI section easier and VALR quite difficult.

XAT Exam Preparation 2025

XAT exam preparation need at least six to nine for those who are appearing for this national-level entrance exam for the very first time. XAT exam paper comprises four sections: Verbal Ability and Logical Reasoning, Decision Making, Quantitative Ability & Data Interpretation, and General Knowledge. In the recent release of the XAT exam, from now on authorities have removed the essay writing section. 

  • Join online study groups on the platform like YouTube, Facebook, Whatsapp and Telegram
  • Choose the best study material recommended by previous year toppers and experts
  • Always start with topics which you are already familiar and on which you have good command
  •  After completing a topic do it's revision for the better understanding
  • Try to complete XAT syllabus first and then take XAT mock test on regular basis

What after XAT result 2025?

After the announcement of the XAT 2025 result, the XLRI and other MBA colleges will conduct their admission process for MBA/ PGDM courses. The selection process of XAT accepting colleges will have two rounds Group Exercise (GE) and Personal Interview (PI). It is expected that the shortlisting of candidates for the GE-PI process will probably take place in February 2025. The XLRI admission process includes three stages.  

Stage 1: Shortlisting of candidates for PI process based on XAT score

Stage 2: Conduct of Group Discussion/ Exercise (GD) and Personal Interview (PI)

Stage 3: Final selection of candidates for admission into MBA/ PGDM program and release of final XAT merit list

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
What is XAT exam eligibility?

Before filling out the application form for the XAT exam 2025, candidates are advised to go through the XAT exam eligibility criteria. Details pertaining to the educational qualification required, marks, age limit, and related will be mentioned under the XAT 2025 eligibility criteria. XLRI Jamshedpur will predefine the eligibility criteria for XAT 2025. 

Check out below the XAT exam eligibility.

  • The candidate must hold a bachelor’s degree of a minimum of three years duration or equivalent in any discipline from a recognised university.
  • Students in the final year of their bachelor's degree or awaiting their results are also eligible to apply for the XAT exam 2025.
  • There is no specific CGPA or percentage mentioned that has to be obtained at graduation. 
  • No age limit has been specified to appear for the XAT exam.

One of the key points prescribed by XLRI in the XAT eligibility criteria is that the candidates must declare and maintain a valid and unique email account and phone number throughout the selection process.

NOTE: The mere fulfilment of the minimum XAT eligibility criteria does not ensure consideration for shortlisting by XLRI, SPJIMR, XIMB, IMT, TAPMI, or other B-schools in which the applicant applies for PGDM admission.

application_process.html_content:
XAT exam 2025 registration process will begin on July 15 and be closed on November 30, 2024. Candidates can fill out the XAT exam form online at xatonline.in. Candidates applying for the XAT exam 2025, have to pay the XAT exam fee of Rs 2200. Those who are interested in XLRI programmes have to pay an additional fee of Rs. 200 each.

How to fill XAT Exam Registration Form?

Candidates can check the XAT 2025 exam registration process in the steps given below:

Step 1: Register on the official XAT website, xatonline.in to get the XAT exam 2025 ID and password
Step 2: Fill in complete personal details in the XAT exam 2025 registration and application Form
Step 3: Fill in academics from classes 10 & 12 on the next page of the XAT form
Step 4: Fill in details of other qualifications, graduation & work experience
Step 5: Fill in your choice of XLRI programmes and choice of XAT exam city
Step 6: Upload documents in an essential format and size.
Step 7: Complete an XAT declaration form.
Step 8: Make a payment online for XAT 2025 application form fees and XLRI Programme application fee.

Documents to upload with the XAT exam form

  • Passport size photograph (size – 20 KB to 50 KB) in jpeg/jpg format
  • Signature (size – 20 KB to 20 KB) in jpeg/jpg format

Correction in the XAT Exam 2025 application:

To change the test city preference, candidates can write to admis@xlri.ac.in mentioning their XAT exam ID, Father's Name, Date of Birth, chosen exam city, and updated city by the date specified by XLRI. This XAT exam form correction facility is active as of the last week of November 2024. The change in the test city option is provisional and XLRI will take the final decision on it.

How do I retrieve the XAT password?

In case a candidate forgot their XAT credentials, then in such case they can retrieve XAT exam credentials by following the provided steps.

Step 1- Click on the XAT exam registration tab

Step 2- Now click on the "Forgot Password" button

Step 3- Candidates will have to provide their registered email ID and phone number (Email and contact number should be the same as they used at the time of XAT exam registration).

Step 4- Enter the required captcha code

Step 5- Now click on the "Get Password" tab

Step 6- XAT exam registration ID and password will be mailed to candidate's registered email ID

admit_card.html_content:
XAT exam 2025 admit card will be issued on the official website on December 20, 2024, in online mode. XAT 2025 admit card will include all the details about the entrance test such as XAT exam centre details, candidate’s roll number, reporting time, and exam day guidelines. Candidates can download the admit card for XAT after entering their registered email ID and password.

How to download the XAT exam 2025 admit card?

  • Log in to the official website of XAT: xatonline.in.
  • Enter your email ID and password.
  • XAT exam 2025 admit card is displayed on the screen.
  • Use the download tab to avail yourself of the admit card before appearing for XAT 2025.

Details mentioned on the XAT exam 2025 hall ticket

  • Name of the candidate
  • XAT ID
  • Photograph of the candidate*
  • Signature to be placed in front of the invigilator in the exam hall
  • XAT exam centre name and address
  • XAT exam date and time
  • Instructions about the XAT entrance exam

*One photograph must be pasted after downloading the XAT exam admit card. It must match the photograph uploaded with the application form for XAT 2025. Test takers must keep a copy of the XAT hall ticket until the entire admission process gets over, as it will be required at every stage.

XAT 2025 exam day guidelines

  • Carry the XAT 2025 exam admit card along with a valid photo ID as specified.
  • Paste a photograph on the admit card of XAT and put the signature in the given space in front of the invigilator in the exam hall
  • Arrive early and report at the time given on the XLRI XAT exam admit card
  • Do not carry any prohibited items like electronic or communication devices, stationary, etc.

cutoffs.html_content:
XAT 2025 cutoff will be released by XLRI Jamshedpur for each program. Candidates who meet the cut off prescribed by the institute will have to appear for the next round of selection procedures, which include group discussion and personal interview rounds. 

The cutoff of the XAT exam is the minimum marks to be scored by a candidate in order to qualify for the admission process. The cutoff is determined by some important factors, which include the 

  • difficulty level of the XAT exam
  • number of candidates appearing 
  • the availability of seats, and
  • previous year's cut off trends. 

If a candidate meets the XAT exam 2025 cutoff criterion, she/he will be shortlisted for the selection rounds- Group Discussion and Personal Interview. 

The XAT exam cutoff is usually different at each institute. Meeting the XAT cutoff criterion is the first stage of the admission process. If the test taker qualifies, s/he attends GD, WAT, and PI. The overall performance in each round, along with the candidates' academic scores, will be considered before the final selection.

counselling_process.html_content:
Candidates who qualify for the XAT cutoff will have to take part in XAT 2025 counselling. In order to participate in XAT counselling, they will have to first register for the counselling process by entering the login credentials on the official website, after which they are required to pay the respective counselling fee. More than 160 institutes will participate in the XAT 2025 counselling process. Check the XAT counselling process and the steps for registration for the same:

Step 1: Visit the official website of XAT

Step 2: Enter the credentials and log in

Step 3: Make the necessary fee payment

Step 4: After the registration is done, the candidates have to choose and lock in their preferred programme in the institute

Step 5: The final allotment of seats will be done on the basis of the candidates’ choice of filling and locking.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
XLRI has revised the XAT exam pattern 2024, As per the paper pattern, the question paper will have four sections - Decision-making, Verbal and Logical Ability, Data Interpretation and Quantitative Ability (DI & QA), and General Knowledge (GK). Analytical Essay Writing section is scrapped this year and the total number of questions also reduced to 95. The XAT 2025 exam pattern states that it have objective (multiple-choice) questions and one subjective question.

XAT Exam Pattern 2025: Sectional Breakup of questions

Part 1Part 2
Sections

Verbal Ability and Logical Reasoning (VA & LR)

Decision Making (DM)

Quantitative Aptitude and Data Interpretation (QA & DI)

General Knowledge (GK)
Duration170 Minutes10 Minutes
Number of questionsAbout 26About 21About 28About 20
Type of questionsThe VA & LR section will comprise questions from critical & analytical reasoning, reading comprehension (including poems & passages), Vocabulary, English Grammar, and other related exercises such as para jumbles, close tests etc.The DM section will present scenarios drawn from both personal and professional lives. Candidates will be required to apply critical thinking, problem-solving skills, and prioritization to make informed decisions.In QA & DI section, the questions are designed to assess the quantitative aptitude of candidates who possess a foundational understanding of arithmetic, algebra, geometry, mensuration, modern maths, etc. The questions on DI are about clear interpretation, summarization, and insightful analysis of the data.

In the GK section, 8 questions will focus on static GK, while the remaining 12 will delve into current affairs.


Marking Scheme
  • For each correct answer: +1 mark
  • For each incorrect answer: -0.25 marks
  • Negative marks awarded for each unattempted question after 8
  • unattempted questions: -0.10 marks

General Knowledge (GK) Score: The score from the General Knowledge (GK) section will be exclusively utilized by XLRI Jamshedpur for its final selection process.

Analytical Essay Writing (AEW): This year, the Analytical Essay Writing (AEW) will be administered during the Group Discussion & Personal Interview (GD / PI) processes.

about_exam.description:
The CET Cell Maharashtra has declared the MAH BBA CET result 2024 for additional exam at the official website - cetcell.mahacet.org. Candidates have to use their login credentials as the application number and password to download the MAH BBA CET result 2024 additional exam. The MAH BBA CET 2024 additional CET exam was conducted on August 4. Candidates qualified are eligible to participate in the counselling and seat allotment process. The MAH BBA CET counselling process will begin with registration, followed by choice filling & locking, merit list, and seat allotment.

The MAH BBA CET application form 2024 dates extended for the additional CET were from July 4 to 8. The MAH BBA CET 2024 application form dates earlier were from June 29 to July 3. The Maharashtra CET cell declared the MAH BBA CET result 2024 for test held on May 29 at the official website- cetcell.mahacet.org. MAH BBA CET 2024 answer key was released on June 8 at cetcell.mahacet.org.  Along with the answer key, the authorities also opened the objection window from June 8 to 10, 2024. Aspirants having any issues with the MAH BBA CET answer key could raise objections against the same. MAH BBA CET result 2024 was declared after considering the objections. 

MAH BBA CET 2024 was held on May 29 for a duration of 90 minutes. Candidates had to carry an admit card and a valid ID proof to the exam centre. Earlier,  interested candidates could register for the MAH BBA CET exam 2024 from March 21 to April 30. Candidates who have passed class 12 or are appearing in 10+2 were eligible to apply for Maharashtra BBA entrance exam 2024. Aspirants who appeared for the MAH BBA CET 2024 exam were advised to check the syllabus and exam pattern carefully. As per the MAH BBA exam pattern 2024, the question paper had 100 Questions based on Reasoning (Verbal as well as Arithmetic), English Language & General Awareness.

highlights.value: State Common Entrance Test Cell, Government of Maharashtra

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The authorities released the eligibility criteria of MAH BBA CET 2024. Candidates who wish to get admission to Maharashtra BBA colleges through CET exam to check the eligibility criteria beforehand. The eligibility criteria include the minimum requirement for admission to MAH BBA CET 2024 colleges. 

  • Passed 10 + 2 (HSC) or its equivalent examination (As per the AICTE APH 2024 - 2027).

  • Candidates appearing for 10 + 2 (HSC) or its equivalent examination are also eligible to appear for CET.

application_process.html_content:
CET Cell Maharashtra closed the MAH BBA CET 2024 registration process. The authorities reopened the MAH BBA CET registration 2024 from May 4 to 5. While filling out the application form of MAH BBA CET 2024, candidates had to submit their personal and academic details, followed by uploading of documents and payment of registration fee. 

  • Visit MAH BBA CET official website - cetcell.mahacet.org 

  • Click on the link to fill application form

  • Complete the registration process by providing basic information such as name, gender, mobile number, and email id.
    Upon successful registration, application number will be generated. Use the login credentials and submit personal and academic details. 

  • Next, upload required documents as per the specified format. 

  • Finally, make the payment of the application fee.

admit_card.html_content:
The authorities released the MAH BBA CET admit card 2024 for all registered candidates at cetcell.mahacet.org on May 24. Aspirants to use their application number and date of birth to download the admit card for MAH BBA CET 2024. Details related to the allotted exam centre were available to students through MAH BBA CET 2024 admit card. 

Steps to download MAH BBA CET admit card 2024 

  • Visit cetcell.mahacet.org 

  • Click on the link to download the admit card

  • Login using application number and password 

  • Upon successful login, the admit card of MAH BBA CET 2024 will be displayed on the screen

  • Download and take a printout of the same.

cutoffs.html_content: The MAH BBA CET cutoff 2024 is the minimum score that determines the eligibility of the candidate for admission. The MAH BBA CET 2024 cutoff will be released at the official website - cetcell.mahacet.org. The authorities will release the MAH BBA CET cutoff 2024 along with each round of CAP counselling. Candidates will be able to check the MAH BBA CET 2024 cutoff after the official release. The students who are above and upto the mark of MAH BBA CET cutoff will be eligible for 2024 admission.

counselling_process.html_content: Candidates qualified the MAH BBA CET 2024 entrance exam will be eligible for the counselling and seat allotment process. The authorities released the MAH BBA CET CAP dates 2024 for the additional CET conducted at cetcell.maahcet.org. The counselling of MAH BBA CET 2024 consists of registration, merit list,  choice filling & locking, seat allotment, and payment of seat acceptance fee. The MAH BBA additional CET counselling registration dates will start from August 29 to September 6, 2024 tentatively. The MAH BBA additional CET 2024 provisional merit list is expected to be released on September 9. Candidates can submit the grievances, if any, from September 10 to 12, 2024. The MAH BBA additional CET final merit list release date is September 13, 2024.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Candidates can access the MAH BBA CET 2024 exam pattern through the official brochure. With the help of the exam pattern of MAH BBA CET 2024, candidates can know details on the types of questions asked, duration, total questions, sections and much more. Aspirants are advised to carefully check the MAH BBA CET paper pattern to increase their chances of acing the entrance exam.

exam_name: ACAT - Amrita Common Aptitude Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
ACAT phase 2 registration's last date is April 25 for Amravati and May 2 for Nagercoil. As per the released schedule, ACAT 2025 phase 2 will be held on April 28 (Amaravati) and May 5 (Nagercoil). Amrita Common Aptitude Test (ACAT) 2025 will be held on March 8 and 9, 2025 (Phase 1). The application form for ACAT 2025 begins on September 7, 2024. Candidates can fill out the ACAT exam 2025 form till February 28, 2025. Amrita ACAT exam is a nationwide test conducted to offer admission into the MBA program at its 6 campuses in Amritapuri, Amaravati, Bengaluru, Coimbatore, Nagercoil, and Kochi. The ACAT entrance exam 2025 will be conducted in a Computer-Based Test (CBT) mode. The ACAT 2025 exam form will be available in online mode at amrita.edu. Apart from the Amrita Common Aptitude Test (ACAT), the university will also accept the scorecard of CAT/ XAT/ MAT/ CMAT/ GMAT/ GRE to offer admission into the MBA program. Read this article to know all about ACAT 2025.

About Amrita School of Business 

Amrita School of Business is one of the leading top 27 B-School across the country which was established in 1996. Coimbatore Campus is AACSB (The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business) accredited and is the 11th School in India and is among the world’s Top 5% of Business schools to be accredited by AACSB (USA), the Global Standards for B- Schools.

Amrita School of Business- Key Points

  • Globally benchmarked curriculum
  • Alumni network of 3000+ worldwide
  • Offers summer internships in leading corporate firms with a stipend and pre-placement offers.
  • Global exposure through collaboration with many reputed universities like the University of Groningen, Vrije University Amsterdam, Deakin University, Aalto University, etc.

  • Faculty hail from IIMs, IITs, Berkely, Cornell, XLRI, London School of Economics and Political Science, etc.

As per the Amrita Business School placement report, they have recorded 98.41% of students placed, and more than 118 companies visited the campus for the recruitment drive. The highest CTC offered in the placement drive was Rs 24.84 LPA and the average CTC was Rs 8.98 LPA.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
As per the basic ACAT 2025 eligibility criteria, candidates should have completed their graduation in any discipline in the pattern of 10+2+3 from a recognized university or institution. 

  • Candidates should have secured at least 50% marks in total aggregate in the 10th, 12th, and Undergraduate (UG) levels. Students in the final year of graduation are also eligible to apply for ACAT 2025.
  • Any one of the valid test scores of Rank in Amrita Common Aptitude Test (ACAT)/ CAT/ XAT/ MAT/ CMAT/ KMAT/ GMAT/ GRE. Candidates appearing for these MBA entrance tests can apply with the test registration number.
  • Amrita School of Business, Coimbatore campus accepts NMAT scores.
  • Department of Management, Amritapuri (Kollam), and Kochi campuses accept valid KMAT scores.
  • Those who will apply for MBA-MS at Bengaluru need to have a minimum IBT-TOEFL score of 79 or an IELTS score of 6.5 with an individual score of 6 or a PTE score of 55 with an individual category score of 50.
  • Those appearing for the final year of the Bachelor’s degree examination can also apply, subject to the completion of their examinations and viva voce, if any.
  • For the final year student, it is mandatory for candidates who is provisionally considered eligible by ASB, Coimbatore, and admitted on the MBA course, to submit the mark sheet and degree certification of the final year bachelor’s degree examination by October 2025.
  • Candidates with work experience will have an added advantage for MBA admissions.

application_process.html_content:
The ACAT 2025 application process begins on September 7, 2024. Eligible candidates can fill out the ACAT application form by visiting the official website. Candidates can fill and submit the ACAT registration form probably by February 28, 2025. At the time of the ACAT form candidates will be required to provide all their past academic details and with that, they have to upload all the required documents. 

Documents/ details to be kept ready before filling ACAT 2025 application form.

  • Valid phone number and email ID
  • Past academic details
  • Scanned copy of photograph and signature
  • Credit/ debit card or net banking details

ACAT 2025 Application Fee

  • The ACAT 2025 application fee will be Rs 1500 + GST
  • Candidates can pay the application fee through an online medium

  • ACAT 2025 application fee will be non-refundable

ACAT 2025 Application Process

  • Registration
  • Verify Email/ Mobile number
  • Fill out the application form online
  • Personal information
  • Academic details
  • Payment of application fee

  • Upload documents

admit_card.html_content:
Amrita Common Aptitude Test (ACAT) admit card will be issued in online mode on the official website. ACAT admit card will be issued 2 weeks before the commencement of the entrance test. Those candidates who will fill out and submit the ACAT application form successfully, only they will get the admit card for the same.

On the day of the ACAT entrance exam, it is mandatory for the candidates to carry the ACAT admit card along with one valid photo ID proof.

cutoffs.html_content: N/A

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
As per the Amrita Common Aptitude Test (ACAT) pattern, the exam will be held in computer-based mode. The duration of the ACAT entrance test will be 2.5 hours (150 minutes) which consists of a total of 100 multiple choice questions (MCQs) divided into four sections- Verbal Reasoning and language Comprehension, Data Interpretation and analysis, General Knowledge of Indian and global Scenarios, and Quantitative Aptitude. 

Each section will comprise 25 questions and each question carries 3 marks. ACAT entrance test will be held across India via Computer Based Test Mode (CBT) mode.   

ACAT Marking Scheme 2025

  • For every correct answer, 3 marks will be awarded.
  • 1 mark will be deducted for every incorrect response.

exam_name: PU MET - Panjab University Management Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Panjab University (PU) Chandigarh will conduct the PU MET Exam 2024 on April 28, 2024. The admit card for the same has been issued on April 23, 2024, in online mode. Candidates can download their PU MET admit card 2024 at met.puchd.ac.in by entering their login ID and password. The PU MET Exam 2024 will be held only in Chandigarh. Earlier, the registration process for the PU MET 2024 was closed on April 3, 2024. The fee payment window for PUMET 2024 was closed on April 10, 2024. The last date to upload the required document is April 16, 2024.

What is PU MET Exam?

PU MET is a university-level entrance examination for admission to the MBA program at Panjab University.  PU MET is an objective-type test consisting of 200 multiple-choice questions.  There are 200 MBA seats that will be filled through the PU MET entrance exam. Panjab University offers MBA courses with various specialisations in Retail Management. Banking, Pharmaceutical Management, etc.

The questions asked as per the exam pattern of PU MET 2024 are multiple-choice based on sections namely: Data Interpretation and Problem Solving, Numerical Ability, Verbal Ability/Reasoning, English Comprehension, General Knowledge and Economics, and Business Environment Awareness. The duration of the PU MET exam is 120 minutes and the exam centre is in Chandigarh only.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Panjab University prescribes the eligibility criteria for PU MET 2024, which are different for various management programmes at the university. However, the PU MET 2024 eligibility criteria remain the same and are stated below:

  • Candidates must obtain a Bachelor’s or Master's degree with at least a 50 percent aggregate score (45 percent for SC/ST/BC/PwD candidates) in any discipline from a recognised university.
  • The final-year degree candidates are eligible to apply and can take the written test provisionally as well, but the result of the qualifying examination should be submitted later, as and when required.
  • Age Limit: No mention of age has been made in the official prospectus of PU MET 2024 regarding eligibility criteria.

application_process.html_content:
Panjab University, Chandigarh, invites applications for PU MET in online mode, within the deadline. Applications should be sent along with the exam fees to apply successfully. Candidates can pay the fee through the State Bank of India (SBI) using a website-generated challan in online mode.

After completing the PU MET registration 2024 in online mode, prospective test-takers need to submit a hard copy of the filled-out application form along with the required documents (if any) by registered post, speed post, or by hand to the following address:

Assistant Registrar, UIAMS, South Campus,
Sector 25: Panjab University,
Chandigarh-160014 

Candidates are advised to fill out all the details carefully and lock the section. Once they lock a section, they will not be allowed to change information in that section.

Application Fee: 

Aspiring test-takers belonging to the General category need to pay Rs. 2,395 as the PU MET registration/ application fee 2024, however, the SC/ ST/ Persons with Disability (PwD) candidates will have to pay Rs. 1,198 at the State Bank of India using a website-generated challan.

The examination fee once paid, shall not be refunded under any circumstances. If, after 24 hours of printing the fee slip, the required details are not found in the bank for depositing the application fee for PU MET 2024, applicants need to write to met@pu.ac.in mentioning their problem along with Application number, Full Name, and Date of Birth.

There is one common form for all the management programmes offered at UIAMS and applicants need to fill out a single form for all courses. Prior to filing the application form for PU MET 2024, candidates should check the eligibility criteria to avoid the cancellation of their candidature.

admit_card.html_content: Panjab University issued the PU MET 2024 admit card on April 23 in online mode. The registered candidates can download the PU MET 2024 admit card using their web-account credentials (Login ID and Password). Test takers are advised to keep their admit cards of PU MET 2024 safe until the admission process draws a conclusion and also produce the same on exam day.

cutoffs.html_content:
Panjab University (PU) Chandigarh will release, instead of cutoff, the final merit list of candidates shortlisted for admission. Admission for PU MBA course will be made on the basis of merit determined by scores obtained by the candidates in PU MET entrance exam and Group Discussion (GD) and Personal Interview (PI). 

All candidates regardless of reserved categories and NRI category will, first of all, be considered in General category. But they will compete within their respective categories following the same criteria. Reservation to the reserved category candidates will be given as per the approved norms of Panjab University.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Panjab University formulates the PU MET exam pattern. According to the exam pattern for PU MET 2024, the offline entrance exam will be of two hours duration  and will have 200 multiple-choice questions with four options: A, B, C & D. The exam will be conducted at the university campus in Chandigarh.

The sections of the PU MET exam include:

  •    Economics and Business Environment Awareness
  •    General Knowledge
  •    English Comprehension
  •    Data Interpretation and Problem Solving
  •    Numerical Ability
  •    Verbal Ability/ Reasoning

Scheme of Scoring – According to the exam pattern of PU MET 2024, the primary marking component of the exam is negative marking; 1/4th of the total marks allotted to a particular question will be deducted for every incorrect answer. 1 mark would be awarded for every correct answer. PU MET scores will carry 85 per cent weightage pertaining to the selection of candidates.

faqs.question: What is the PU MET 2024 exam pattern?
faqs.answer: PU MET exam syllabus comprises of topics like English comprehension, verbal ability, numerical ability, data interpretation, general knowledge, economics and business environment awareness.

faqs.question: When will the PU MET 2024 results be declared?
faqs.answer: The PU MET result 2024 was released in May 2024.

faqs.question: What is the selection process after PU MET 2024?
faqs.answer: Candidates who qualified in the PU MET exam will be shortlisted for group discussion and interview rounds. The final MBA admission is offered based only on the cumulative marks achieved by the candidates in all the selection rounds.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for PU MET 2024?
faqs.answer: The eligibility criteria to appear for the Panjab University MBA entrance test is the candidates must have a bachelor's degree in any discipline from an approved university with a minimum aggregate of 50% marks, (45% relaxation for reserved candidates).

faqs.question: What is the meaning of PU MET?
faqs.answer: PU MET means Panjab University Management Entrance Test conducted by Panjab University Chandigarh once a year for MBA admission to the University Institute of Applied Management Services (UIAMS) of Panjab University.

exam_name: JEMAT - Joint Entrance Management Aptitude Test
conducting_body: Maulana Abul Kalam Azad University of Technology

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
JEMAT 2024: The Maulana Abdul Kalam Azad University of Technology (MAKAUT) will conduct JEMAT 2024 (Phase 1) exam on June 29, 2024. JEMAT exam conducting body issued the JEMAT 2024 admit card on June 25 in online mode at cetmat.formflix.com. The JEMAT 2024 mock test link also activated on June 25 and it will be available till June 28. The JEMAT entrance exam is conducted three times a year. The JEMAT exam will be held in computer-based mode (CBT). 

About JEMAT Exam

JEMAT (Joint Entrance Management Aptitude Test)  is a state-level postgraduate entrance examination administered by MAKAUT (Maulana Abul Kalam Azad University of Technology), West Bengal. The mode of the one-hour JEMAT exam earlier used to be pen and paper-based. However, last year the exam was conducted as an online home-based proctored test. JEMAT is conducted multiple times a year for candidates aspiring to pursue management studies and looking forward to getting admissions in Private and Government institutions that offer MBA/MHA courses and accept the JEMAT 2024 Score in West Bengal.

JEMAT comprises as many as 50 MCQs that are to be answered within 60 minutes (1 hour). JEMAT exam 2024 can be summarized in a three-step process, namely, filling out the online JEMAT application form, downloading the online admit card, and finally writing the JEMAT test. Post exams, results are announced by MAKAUT followed by Group Discussion (GD)/ Personal Interview (PI) and Counselling schedules for final admission.

highlights.value: Maulana Abul Kalam Azad University of Technology

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
MAKAUT specified the JEMAT 2024 eligibility criteria and all aspirants are required to meet the requirements to be able to appear in the JEMAT exam 2024. As per the JEMAT 2024 eligibility, the candidate should be a-

  • Citizen of India 
  • Completed AICTE-approved regular Bachelor's Degree in Arts/Science/Commerce/Engineering/Technology/Pharmacy/Architecture/Medical/Dental/Agriculture

OR

  • A final year student of the aforementioned programmes or equivalent. The final year aspirants will be granted provisional admission; however, will need to submit their final mark-sheet before the declared deadline.
  • Candidates who have completed any of the professional programmes from a recognised university/institute must fulfill the JEMAT 2024 eligibility criteria as well.
  • Reservation for SC/ST/OBC-A/OBC-B/PWD will be executed as per the state government rules and regulations.

application_process.html_content:
MAKAUT released JEMAT 2024 (Phase 1) application form in online mode on June 5. Eligible candidates can fill out the JEMAT 2024 application form by visiting the official website till June 22. Aspiring candidates need to  create a web account and then fill out the application form for JEMAT 2024.

How to fill out JEMAT Application Form 2024?

All eligible candidates are expected to provide correct details as false information may result in the cancellation of the particular application form.

  • Candidates need to provide their personal details, namely, Full Name, Gender, Date of Birth, Category, Person with Disability (PwD), Educational Qualification, valid E-mail ID, Mobile Number, Communication Address, Declaration, etc. On JEMAT 2024 application submission, candidates would be asked to re-check the entered details do the needful corrections, if required, and submit the application form.
  • Photo and signature verification: The uploaded image file of both photo and signature should be in .JPG or .JPEG or .PNG format. There will be two separate options for uploading candidates' photos and signatures. They have to click on the tab “Upload Photograph and Signature.”
  • JEMAT application forms will not be accepted without the specified photograph and signature of the applicant.
  • Post-filling the online application form of JEMAT, candidates will be asked to furnish a declaration.
  • After submitting the form, the required physical documents need to be sent to the University at the address provided below-

MAULANA ABUL KALAM AZAD UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY, West Bengal
(Formerly known as WEST BENGAL UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY)
BF-142, SECTOR-1, SALT LAKE, KOLKATA- 700064.

admit_card.html_content:
MAKAUT, West Bengal issued the JEMAT admit card in online mode on June 25. The JEMAT admit card 2024 is available to candidates who successfully submit the online application form within the stipulated deadline. 

Test takers need to produce the admit card of JEMAT on the test day; as candidates are not allowed to take the test without the admit card. Candidates will have to view and download the admit card from the JEMAT web account by entering their Registration number and Password.

The JEMAT 2024 admit card will have the following information-

  • Date of Exam
  • Venue of Exam
  • Time of Exam
  • General Instructions

cutoffs.html_content: N/A

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
According to the exam pattern of JEMAT 2024, it is an online exam test of one hour comprising of 50 questions and 100 marks. As per the JEMAT 2024 exam pattern, it consists of multiple-choice questions (MCQs) with four options to choose from. There are three sections, namely English (40 questions), Mathematics (40 questions), and Logical Reasoning (20 questions). 

The scoring scheme of JEMAT 2024 is pretty simple. +2 for each correct answer choice and a negative marking of 0.25 for each wrong answer.

exam_name: MAH MBA CET - Maharashtra MBA Common Entrance Test
conducting_body: State Common Entrance Test Cell - Maharashtra State

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
MAH MBA CET Exam: CET Cell Maharashtra has released the MBA CET 2024 counselling schedule in online mode at cetcell.mahacet.org. The MAH MBA CET final merit list was released on August 9. The online submission and confirmation options for Round I are available from August 10 to 12. The provisional allotment result for Round I will be released on August 14. MAH CET cut off is released on the official counselling website of CET cell in the form of a merit list.

More than 330 participating institutes accept Maharashtra CET scorecards, including SIMSREE, JBIMS, Welingkar, PUMBA, etc. for admission to the MBA programme. Applicants will be selected for admission to the respective management colleges on the basis of the merit list. 

Top 5 Colleges through MAH MBA CET Scores 2024 - Maharashtra MBA Admission


What is MAH MBA CET Exam?

Maharashtra Common Entrance Test or MAH MBA CET, is a state-level entrance exam that is conducted every year for those candidates who want to be admitted to MBA and MMS courses offered by the participating institutes. In order to be admitted to different participating institutes, candidates have to appear for the Maharashtra MBA CET 2024 exam. 

Candidates having valid scores in CAT/ GMAT/ CMAT/ MAT/ XAT/ ATMA can participate in MAH CET MBA counselling directly, for admission to MBA/ MMS/ PGDM in government, government-aided, and university-affiliated and management institutes. MAH CET 2024 counselling is part of the Centralized Admission Process (CAP). Applicants from outside Maharashtra must have a valid CAT/ MAT/ CMAT/ GMAT/ XAT/ ATMA score in order to apply for admission to MAH MBA CET 2024. The process is carried out by the State Joint Entrance-Test Cell.

The MAH CET is valid for:

  • University Departments of Management Education
  • All Government of Maharashtra Management Education Institutes
  • University Managed Management Education Institutes
  • All Un-Aided Management Education Institutes covered as per the Act

highlights.value: State Common Entrance Test Cell - Maharashtra State

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Eligibility Criteria 

Before MAH CET MBA registration, candidates should check the eligibility criteria carefully. Only eligible candidates are able to register for the exam. Maharashtra MBA CET eligibility criteria is given below. 

Qualification 

Candidates must be a graduate in any discipline from Universities recognised by University Grants Commission (UGC) and Association of Indian Universities (AIU) 

Qualifying marks

  • The minimum percentage requirement in graduation is at least 50% marks in aggregate or equivalent while it is 45 per cent for candidates belonging to backward categories and Persons with Disability of Maharashtra State Only.

  •  Final year degree candidates who have appeared for the exam are also allowed to apply for the exam.

application_process.html_content:
CET Cell Maharashtra released the MAH MBA CET 2024 application form on its official website. Interested and eligible candidates filled MAH MBA CET registration form by visiting the official website. Firstly, applicants had to register by entering a valid e-mail ID and generating a unique password.

After the process of registration, they were required to re-login and fill in all the required details on the form. State Common Entrance Test Cell, Maharashtra, the conducting body of MAH MBA CET did not accept offline application form and fee sent through post/courier or for that matter, any other mode besides online submission of the Maharashtra MBA CET application form.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates planning to appear for MAH MBA CET 2024 must prepare an effective study plan with a strong preparation strategy. To help MBA CET 2024 aspirants execute such plans and strategies they must follow the given MAH MBA CET preparation tips given below.

  • Thoroughly go through the MAH MBA CET exam pattern along with all the topics to be covered in the MBA CET syllabus 2024.
  • Start by clearing your basics, practice easy to moderate questions, and then take up tricky and difficult ones.
  • Study from MBA CET best preparation books and study material available online.
  • Regularly attempt MAH MBA CET mock tests and improvise on time management.
  • Review your performance and work on your weak areas.

Along with these tips, candidates must also prepare an exam day strategy that works best for them keeping in mind that there is no sectional time limit in the MAH MBA CET exam

counselling_process.html_content:
CET Cell Maharashtra has released MAH MBA CET 2024 counselling registration start dates in online mode. Qualified candidates will have to participate in respective counselling rounds (CAP) in online mode.

How to register for MAH MBA CET 2024 Counselling:

The steps to register for the MAH MBA CET counselling process is provided below,

  • Open the official website - cetcell.mahacet.org
  • Click on "New Candidate Registration" and fill necessary details.
  • A User ID and password will be generated.
  • Now, log in to the website to fill out the Maharashtra MBA CET 2024 counselling form.

MAH MBA CET 2024 Counselling Process:

The following is the process of MAH MBA CET 2024 counselling which will be conducted in three stages.

1st Stage: Registration & Fee Payment - Log in to the candidate portal by using valid credentials. They have to enter all the necessary details and upload the required documents. Then counselling fee payment has to be done as per the category. 

CategoryCounselling Fee
GeneralRs. 2000
Reserved Rs. 1800

2nd Stage: Provisional List Announcement - The names of the shortlisted candidates are published as a provisional merit list. They can submit their grievances along with the requisite documents at the facilitation centre.

3rd Stage: Release of Final Merit List - The exam authorities will release the final merit list of MAH MBA CET 2024 counselling. Students who will be shortlisted for the CAP rounds will have to report at the Admission Reporting Centre (ARC) for the document verification process and visit the allotted institute/college to complete the admission process.

Maharashtra MBA CET 2024 Counselling Registration - Highlights

  • Candidates will be able to select a maximum of three choices of colleges.
  • Once the choice is locked, it will not be changed.
  • They need to accept the seat allotment after the seat gets allocated as per their preferences.
  • Candidates are not permitted to participate in subsequent CAP rounds.
  • MAH MBA CET 2024 Seat acceptance fee is not refundable.

exam_name: KMAT Kerala - Kerala Management Admission Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Commissioner of Entrance Exams (CEE) conducts the KMAT Kerala 2024 for MBA admission in top Kerala Govt colleges and some private colleges. The final result of KMAT Kerala 2024 has been declared on July 16, 2024.Candidates can download their KMAT Kerala exam 2024 result at cee.kerala.gov.in in pdf format. Earlier, the provisional result for KMAT Kerala 2024 was released on July 13. The objections against the KMAT Kerala provisional result opened till July 14, 2024. 

The KMAT Kerala exam 2024 was held on June 30. CEE has issued the KMAT Kerala 2024 admit card on June 22. The KMAT Kerala exam 2024 was conducted in all districts in Kerala. CEE conducted session 2 of KMAT Kerala 2024 in computer-based test of 3 hours duration that consisted of 180 objective-type questions in;

  • English Language Usage and Reading Comprehension (50 Questions)
  • Quantitative Ability (50 Questions)
  • Data sufficiency and Logical Reasoning (40 Questions)
  • General Awareness and current affairs (40 Questions)

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
As per the eligibility criteria of KMAT Kerala 2024, candidates need to fulfill the following parameters in order to be eligible to apply for the exam:

  • At least 50% marks in aggregate (45% for SC/ST candidates) in graduation (minimum 3 years) from a recognized board/university/education body are eligible to apply Or
  • A master's degree with at least 50 percent marks in aggregate (45 percent for SC/ST candidates) from any recognized education body in Commerce, Management, Arts, Social Sciences, Engineering/ Technology or equivalent is eligible to apply for the exam.
  • Final-year graduation students are also eligible to apply.

application_process.html_content:
The KMAT Kerala 2024 application form for session 2 was released in online mode on May 30. CEE closed the KMAT Kerala registration window on June 10, 2024. Candidates can fill out the KMAT Kerala registration form in online mode at cee.kerala.gov.in.

KMAT Kerala Application Fee: The application fee for general category candidates was Rs. 1000 and Rs. 750 for SC/ST category candidates.

How to fill KMAT Kerala 2024 Application Form?

Candidates need to follow the below-given steps in order to apply for the KMAT Kerala Exam 2024:

  • Visit the official website.
  • Fill in your personal details and submit.
  • After submission, you will get a unique KMAT Kerala application number along with the password (Date of Birth).
  • Now, visit the official website again and login with your application number and password.
  • Fill in all the details asked for and pay the application fee.
  • Upload a scanned image of your photograph and signature.
  • Choose exam centres. You can select up to three exam centres. 
  • A profile verification window will pop up on the screen. You are advised to check all the details and take the printout.

admit_card.html_content:
The authority issued the KMAT Kerala 2024 admit card (Session 2) in online mode on its official website.  The admit card for KMAT Kerala 2024 is available in online mode only. Candidates will not be allowed to appear for the exam without the KMAT Kerala exam 2024 admit card.

To download the KMAT Kerala admit card 2024, candidates need to follow the below-given steps:

  • Click on the ‘Admit Card’ tab.
  • The admit card for KMAT Kerala 2024 will appear on the screen.
  • Download the KMAT Kerala admit card and take printouts.
  • Keep a soft copy for future use.

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, School of Management will conduct the KIITEE 2025 entrance exam from January 11 to 13, 2025. The registration process for the KIITEE exam 2025 has commenced in online mode at ksom.ac.in. Candidates can fill out the KIITEE 2025 application form by January 6, 2025. The KIITEE Management 2025 has five sections: Quantitative Aptitude, Analytical Reasoning, English, General Knowledge, and Issue of Social Concern. The KIITEE Management Exam will be of 2 and half hours (150 minutes) in duration. There will be a total of 150 multiple choice type of questions. The language of the questions will be in English. The questions will not be in any other language. All the questions will be of objective type with three marks (+3) for each correct response, minus one mark (-1) for each incorrect response & zero (0) for no response.

The KIIT Management entrance exam is conducted for three programs: MBA at KIITSOM MBA (Rural Management) at KIIT School of Rural Management and MBA (Agri-Business Management) at KIIT School of Rural Management (KSRM). To provide admission in the MBA program, KSOM also considers other national-level tests like CAT/ MAT/ GMAT/ CMAT/ XAT/ ATMA. Candidates having any of these scores are exempted from giving KIIT Management 2025.

Candidates can check the KIIT MBA result by using their login credentials on the official website of KSOM. Given below table gives an overview of KIIT Management 2025 which can be referred to if candidates are planning to take admission in programs offered by Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology’s School of Management (KSOM).
